Around the base of the trees, ornate yucca baskets trimmed with quail and meadowlark feathers hold fragrant sage leaves and bundles of delicate bird bones wrapped with braided grass. A small altar crafted of deep purple osage heartwood holds a beaded hawk-wing fan framing a brass bowl filled with milk.

node.name: Zaldi Taipa, Shaded Grove
node.description: A grove of white-barked aspens lifts to the sky, their leaves a dance of moon-silvered green and gold. Lashed between them is a canopy of alabaster felt edged with a row of tiny silver bells and amber-beaded feathers. An elaborately carved sandalwood bucket filled with grain sits amidst a drift of the sweet grasses that grow thickly around the tree trunks.

White-barked sycamores lift to the sky, their leaves a dance of sun-washed green and gold. Lashed between them is a canopy of alabaster felt edged with a row of tiny silver bells and amber-beaded feathers. An elaborately carved sandalwood bucket filled with grain sits amidst a drift of the sweet grasses that grow thickly around the tree trunks.

node.name: Zaldi Taipa, Shaded Grove
node.description: Flinging rainbowed prisms of mist as it tumbles along, a little creek rushes from the grasslands beyond. Coursing over polished stones that gleam through the clarity of the water, it finally drops into a wide, rocky basin encircled with a natural garden of moss, cinnamon fern, and wild iris.

node.name: Zaldi Taipa, Chieftain's Chadir
node.description: Wooden latticework lines the white felt interior of the spacious chadir, its slats running upward to the 'sky-door' -- a circular roof opening covered with azure silk. In this central area meant for greeting visitors, the crisp scent of grass floor mats mixes with the welcoming aroma of warm aszal and other treats set out on an oak table. Vivid colors cloak the walls in scenes of clan life depicted on a series of tapestries, while clouded arzumos furs cover the entrances to the living areas.

node.name: Zaldi Taipa, Chieftain's Chadir
node.description: The rich simplicity of the personal quarters of this aristocrat of the steppes reflects the wild beauty of his world. One entire wall is covered by the gleaming pelt of a snow leopard hunted down on some remote, icy peak, and an amber-beaded spirit wheel hangs from the ceiling, the eagle feathers at its center swaying gently in the air. Along the floor, the starkly elegant patterns of Horse Clan tapestries surround an oak table and a sleeping pad strewn with lush black-and-gold jaguar furs.

node.name: Zaldi Taipa, Chieftain's Chadir
node.description: Quiet descends in this chamber designed for work or silent thought. The entrance is sheltered from visitors' eyes by the ivory and gold fur of a clouded arzumos, and whirlwind-patterned baskets against the wall are filled with white sage leaves that fill the air with the warm scent of the open steppes. A low table and chairs are the only furnishings. Almost stark in their simplicity, they are yet as regal as any courtly furniture thanks to the rare osage heartwood from which they are crafted.

node.name: Zaldi Taipa, Jan Taipen Chadir
node.description: Moonlight filters through blue-green silk draped over the opening at the tent's apex, the wash of cool hues creating a dreamlike atmosphere heightened by the scent of sage rising from triple-coil baskets lining the walls. Taller baskets holding an assortment of gourd rattles and feathered prayer sticks surround a gleaming white and gold saddle dominating the center of the room. Near the saddle, an osage heartwood altar holds a pair of clay bowls -- one filled with milk, the other with grain.

Sunlight filters through blue-green silk draped over the opening at the tent's apex, the wash of cool hues creating a dreamlike atmosphere heightened by the scent of sage rising from triple-coil baskets lining the walls. Taller baskets holding an assortment of gourd rattles and feathered prayer sticks surround a gleaming white and gold saddle dominating the center of the room. Near the saddle, an osage heartwood altar holds a pair of clay bowls -- one filled with milk, the other with grain.

node.name: Zaldi Taipa, Horse-trader's Chadir
node.description: The world outside grows distant as luxury offers its embrace. Wine-colored carpets soften each step, and silks and brocades in saffron and blue create a flow of rich colors from floor to ceiling. Horseflesh is serious business here: Elegant sculptures of great past horses grace the corners, bridles so ornate that they could command a ransom hang from the walls like fine paintings, and a carved sandalwood table bears a locked, leather-bound book titled 'Lineage of the Akhaal'.

node.name: Zaldi Taipa, Yasnah's Cashmere
node.description: Fresh rushes and sweet grass cover the floor, crackling with each step and making the air smell of meadows and sunshine. Thick deobar crossbeams stretch upwards from the stout center pole like the branches of a short but sturdy tree.

node.name: Zaldi Taipa, Bowyer
node.description: Fresh air wafts down from the opening at the apex of the tent, bringing the crisp, golden scent of the grasslands into the room. A tall aspen pole, carved top to bottom with birds in flight, has been pegged so that quivers may be hung from it. Nearby, a deep willow basket edged with the coppery iridescence of pheasant feathers holds an assortment of fletching pouches.

node.name: Zaldi Taipa, Bowyer
node.description: Fabric dyed the color of the winter sky covers a framework of interlaced aspen poles. White felt edged with black goat hide and embroidered with colorful vines and birds drapes the entryway. In the corners, tall willow baskets are filled with fragrant juniper boughs that fill the air with a sharp, cool scent.

node.name: Zaldi Taipa, Potter
node.description: Rushes crackle underfoot, bringing the scent of sun-dried grasses to mix pleasantly with the earthier smell of clay. Along the walls is an array of mixing vessels, and loops of cord suspend an assortment of yucca-leaf brushes used to decorate the pottery that fills the room. One corner is crowded with flat baskets holding little jars of paint, multi-colored shards, and shining fragments of crushed mica.

node.name: Zaldi Taipa, Ela's Equine Supplies
node.description: All kinds of tack and horse supplies fill the inside of the tent. Saddles and bridles, halters and combs -- everything a horse could need is contained in this tent. An important-looking sign painted with various images of horses hangs over a pile of trunks and baskets, and a large feed box sits nearby.

node.name: Zaldi Taipa, Ela's Equine Supplies
node.description: Cut off from the rest of the tent by an elaborate screen, this back room is filled with the pleasant scent of leather. The walls are draped with heavy wool tapestries in fine-lined geometric patterns, their simplicity providing a perfect background for the array of available tack crafted in traditional style by the artisans of Horse Clan.

node.name: Zaldi Taipa, Anaylisse's Felterie
node.description: Color abounds everywhere within this warm and cozy place. Vibrant hues echo about the circular walls in beautifully crafted tapestries. A sky of midnight blue felt sprinkled with crystal stars forms the roof, supported by a thick central pole of dark, polished deobar.

node.name: Zaldi Taipa, Anaylisse's Felterie
node.description: The warm glow of oil lamps reveal baskets of felt creations in various stages of construction lined up like toy soldiers against the walls. Balls of colored silk and finely spun wool fill one large crate, mounded like gems on a Trader's table. A slender pole of polished oak supports the roof, where silk-clad dancers with bracelet covered wrists spin and twirl on pointed toes to the soundless music of the felt-crafted musicians stitched about the walls.

node.name: Zaldi Taipa, The Lamb's Shank
node.description: Long, spotlessly clean tables line the spacious dining area, comfortable padded benches pulled up at each one. The air is redolent with the odor of spicy foods, various teas, and the crisp scent of grass mats on the ground. From just outside, the cheerful clatter of cooking over open grills can be heard. Large panels with mesh inserts have been cut along the sides of the tent so that the walls can be rolled up in the summer or dropped and snugly secured in cold weather.

node.name: The Lamb's Shank, Quiet Corner
node.description: One corner of the tent has been screened off with heavy felt drapes, providing at least a bit of privacy for those who wish to have their meal in more solitude than can be had in the larger communal area.

node.name: Zaldi Taipa, Shepherd's Chadir
node.description: Perhaps deriving a perverse satisfaction from treading on the creatures that are often thorns in his side, the shepherd has flung the skins of various predators on the floor of his compact tent. The central space is taken up by the tawny hide of a large cougar, while the heavier furs of wolf, coyote, and even a spotted lynx are arranged along the sides. Interspersed among the simple items that make the tent a home are sheep-sized halters, baskets of medicinal herbs, and other tools of the trade.

node.name: Zaldi Taipa, Furrier
node.description: Furs in hues of buff and cream and sable hang side by side, contrasting warmly with the deep green felt of the walls. The air is full of the scent of leather and tanned hides, though there is an undercurrent of a wild, musky odor -- a reminder of the creatures whose existence played out in the grasslands and forests beyond this tent. Niklotai, the shepherd's son, hums tunelessly as he sorts a stack of cougar hides by color and quality.

node.name: The Western Road, Farmlands
node.description: Fields to the north and south of the road look cultivated, or at least were tilled some short time in the past. The road is in good repair, which argues for a local population that takes on the task of maintenance.

node.name: The Western Road, Farmlands
node.description: Yew trees line the road, and a carpet of their fallen needles cushions the wheel or foot that nears them. Judging from their size, the trees have a few years on them and were obviously placed by design rather than nature.

Yew trees line the road, bordering it in a stately procession to the west. A carpet of their fallen needles cushions the wheel or foot that travels in their shade. Judging from their size, the trees have a few years on them and were obviously placed by design rather than nature.

node.name: The Western Road, A Ruined Manse
node.description: A short avenue of yew trees leads to a low pile of rubble. It must have been a noteworthy manse at one time: the extent of the remains, the carriage drive before what was its entrance, and the circle of sheltering trees all bespeak a residence of importance in the region.

node.name: The Western Road, Farmlands
node.description: On each side of the road is a colonnade of yew trees whose lines extend a fair distance to the east and whose fallen needles hush the noises of the road. Whoever planted the big trees wanted something impressive, even showy, and they serve the purpose well.

node.name: The Western Road, Farmlands
node.description: A boldly carved wooden figure stands on a polished sandstone slab in the middle of the road, surrounded by piles of drying flowers, food, and other offerings. A circle of benches surrounds the statue for those who wish to break their journey for rest or reflection.

node.name: The Western Road, Foothills
node.description: The road occasionally greets a tilled field, but for the most part, scrub grasses separate stands of trees. The groups of sumac, laurel, birch, and a few firs are denser and more numerous to the west than to the east.

node.name: The Western Road, Foothills
node.description: Obstinate ridges run north and south, frustrating travelers whose journeys go from east to west and back again. One such ridge to the west forces the road through several switchbacks along a forested hillside.

node.name: The Western Road, Foothills
node.description: Although the road is not terribly steep, a dislodged stone or a kicked pine cone may well roll a good distance before coming to rest. One might enjoy a good view of the countryside from here, midway up the side of the ridge, were it not for the thick stand of pines that lines the road.

node.name: The Western Road, Atop the Ridge
node.description: The tread of many, many patient boots and hooves has worn the roadway down, and it crosses the top of the ridge several feet below the shoulders on either side. But the sunken path proves to be a blessing because the higher sides keep travelers on the road, even in the gloom of the forested ridge.

The tread of many, many patient boots and hooves has worn the roadway down, and it crosses the top of the ridge several feet below the shoulders on either side. The sunken path and the surrounding forest dim the light guiding the traveler's way, even on the brightest day.

node.name: The Western Road, The Spring
node.description: A constant splashing alerts the traveler to the presence of a spring. The sound comes from a conveniently located stone trough by the side of the road.

A mountain spring has been cleaned out near the road and piped into a stone trough, making the cold water available for man and beast alike. The overflow from the trough runs downhill into the forest, away from the road, which follows higher ground.

node.name: The Western Road, Big Meadow
node.description: The road crosses the eastern and higher end of a big clearing. One may well stray off the road, but at least there's no danger of walking into a tree.

The road crosses the eastern end of a big clearing, an unusual sight in the wooded foothills. No mark of axe or saw can be seen, so the lea must have resulted from a natural event, perhaps a forest fire. Downhill to the west, saplings around the edge show the slow return of the trees, and in fifty years no trace will remain of the meadow.

node.name: The Western Road, Big Meadow
node.description: Scrub brush and low saplings flank the road at the lower, western end of a big clearing. From downhill comes the sound of flowing water.
Scrub brush and low saplings flank the road at the lower, western end of a big clearing, not far from a stream in the valley. Higher up, the meadow looks freer of the encroaching forest.

node.name: The Western Road, Stream Bank
node.description: A shallow stream running down the valley crosses the road, its banks decorated by leafy ferns. Bullfrogs boom and now and then an owl hoots in its hunting. To the southeast, the road runs uphill.

A shallow stream running down the valley crosses the road, its banks decorated by leafy ferns. Frogs call, birds sing and dragonflies dart and hover over the water. To the southeast, the road runs uphill through a big meadow.

node.name: The Western Road, The Stream
node.description: The comfortable current and the pebbly bottom of the shallow stream make about as good a road as any on this long trek. The bank is high and undercut to the west, and the water deepens to the south, making both of those directions look chancy.

node.name: The Western Road, The Stream
node.description: A pool of friendly dimensions is a welcome spot for a dip or a bath, if one doesn't mind the chill mountain water. Besides the sound of the stream itself, a louder splash is sometimes heard, a reminder that other visitors may be enjoying the water too.

A pool of friendly dimensions is a welcome spot for a dip or a bath, if one doesn't mind the chill mountain water. Green fronds ripple on the bottom of the pool, clouds of minnows scatter and form, and now and then a larger fish swims into view, all distinctly visible through the clear water.

node.name: The Western Road, The Stream
node.description: The road joins the streambed to the west where the bank is low and firm.

The mud of a lower bank to the west is marked with footprints and wagon tracks, evidence of a pretty steady flow of traffic. Probably many of those feet, sore from their wayfaring, have found refreshment in these waters.

node.name: The Western Road, Stream Bank
node.description: A steeply inclined road joins the top of a ridge to the west to the stream that runs through the valley. The ridge is thickly forested with long-leaf pines, hemlocks and some mountain laurel, but the woods seem thinner toward the top.

node.name: The Western Road, Atop the Ridge
node.description: A cold northern wind scours the top of the ridge, and the area seems doubly exposed because it has been cleared of trees and brush where the road crosses. Except for the wind there is almost no sound -- not even the rustle of leaves or the quiet patter of falling needles.

The top of the ridge has been cleared of trees where the road crosses, revealing a sweeping vista of jagged, snow-capped mountains to the west and north, the Himineldar Shel and its Dark Pass. To the southwest, a lone hill rises above the plain.

node.name: The Western Road, Foothills
node.description: The road dips slightly between the path north through the forest and a steeper rise to the southeast. Off to one side, victim of some misfortune, sits an abandoned wagon -- or what's left of it after passersby have stripped it of usable parts.

node.name: The Western Road, Foothills
node.description: Northward lies a heavily forested region cast in shade so deep it's hard to see more than a score of yards in that direction. To the south the forest is not so dense, although the trees and the ridges still limit the line of sight.

node.name: Seord Kerwaith, Shadowed Copse
node.description: The pathway widens somewhat to the south, as the trees file close to the rocky pathway cut though the dense forest, forming a living wall of wood. Near the center of the clearing, a small rock shrine rests amongst numerous colorfully painted stones and several bundles of dried flowers. Bamboo wind chimes, hung with a several black crystals, dangle from a low-hanging branch above the center of the clearing, clacking softy in the gentle wilderness breeze.

node.name: Seord Kerwaith, Shadowed Copse
node.description: Through a narrow gap in the canopy to the north, a monstrous snow-capped mountain dominates the sky. Gentle beams of light trickle though the random breaks in the deep green canopy overhead as its swings gently in the breeze. Distant cracks and snaps echo in the distance, their source remaining undiscovered in the thick tangle of brush and leaves.

node.name: Seord Kerwaith, Shadowed Copse
node.description: Following the snake-like curves of the rocky pathway, the mammoth trees press in close to one another as they fight for any available space on the forest floor. A gentle rain of leaves slowly drift to the rocky ground from the canopy above, landing amongst the carpet of organic decay already underfoot.

node.name: Seord Kerwaith, Shadowed Copse
node.description: Every so often wind rolls though the area, sending several of the leaves lining the ground rolling along the reddish-black and burnt amber leaf cover. A distant floral aroma lightens the overbearing musk of earth that hangs like mist on the air and slowly meanders though the wood upon the soft breeze.

node.name: Seord Kerwaith, Shadowed Copse
node.description: Rugged roots from the surrounding trees protrude from the ashy brown soil underfoot, having been exposed by rainwater flowing down the slanted pathway. A cracked leather boot rests lodged between two intertwining roots the size of a Gor'Tog's arm, giving warning to those who choose to incautiously traverse the pathway.

node.name: Seord Kerwaith, Shadowed Copse
node.description: The densely packed trees tower above the winding path, their canopies growing together to cast shifting shadows along the rocky trail. The rustle of leaves trickles down from the lush treetops as flying squirrels leap from branch to branch, chattering noisily as they jump though the sea of green leaves.

node.name: Seord Kerwaith, Shadowed Copse
node.description: The twisted passage meets abruptly with a dense forest, the tangle of branches winding amongst the razor-sharp pinnacle of stone. An icy wind sweeps briskly though the narrow passage with a low howl as it cuts through the stone to the north, causing the foliage of the canopies to rustle softly. Thick creepers wind over the exterior of the stone walls, forming a natural archway over the gaping maw of black stone.

node.name: Seord Kerwaith, Crystalline Gorge
node.description: The valley grows narrow at the southern end where a section of wall has collapsed, cutting a pathway though the black stone. Softly shimmering in the available light, ice crystals cling to the black rock outlining the passage though the jagged stone. To the north, the walls of Raven's Point rise in the distance, dwarfed beneath the massive slopes of the white-capped Himineldar Shel.

node.name: Seord Kerwaith, Crystalline Gorge
node.description: The valley grows narrow as it curls southward, splitting the path into a jagged pattern as it weaves back and forth between the blocky stone sides of the gorge. A thin layer of frost-covered rubble is haphazardly strewn about the remains of a few tents left in ruin. Small flecks of grey and black ash cover the small drifts of snow resting at the base of the wall, slowly swirling across the ground in the invisible currents of chill air.

node.name: Seord Kerwaith, Crystalline Gorge
node.description: The sheer wall of black stone curls high overhead, ending in several rows of curved spikes. A thick layer of frost covers the uneven ground underfoot, and is lightly littered with rubble of various shapes and sizes. A bitter wind sweeps along the curving wall of the valley, carrying shimmering flakes of snow upon their unseen currents. Curious formations of ice rise from the ground at skewed angles, their mirror-like surfaces refracting the available light.

node.name: Seord Kerwaith, Walls of Raven's Point
node.description: Massive rough-cut logs span the gap between the black walls that frame the valley, slipping neatly into reinforced niches cut into the rough stone facade. Discolored patches of grey wood have been hammered into the frost-covered surface of the log walls, mending countless cracks were the frost has managed to split its unfinished grain. The dull chatter of life within the outpost is carried upon the air, rumbling just above the distant howl of the icy mountain gales.

node.name: Seord Kerwaith, Gear Gate
node.description: Rough-cut logs with sharpened peaks reach across the rough stone walls to block further passage though the pass to the north. Thick curls of black smoke spiral into the sky from beyond the makeshift walls of the outpost, the air filled with the pungent aroma of blood sausage and smoking cedar. In the direct center of the fortification, a massive gear gate has been sandwiched between the sharpened log walls, reaching across the valley to slide seamlessly into the black rock walls of the valley.

node.name: Seord Kerwaith, Walls of Raven's Point
node.description: Countless pikes, splattered with rusty stains, are partially buried at the foot of the rough-cut wall that surrounds the outpost. Narrow gaps are cut in the black stone of the valley walls, just large enough to allow the sharpened logs to slide securely into the stone niches, giving the structure added stability. Weather-worn Dwarves patrol the parapets along the interior of the walls, several of them sporadically resting to take a long drag from the curved pipes clenched between their teeth.

node.name: Seord Kerwaith, Crystalline Gorge
node.description: The frigid wind slides smoothly across the rock walls that enclose the valley, pulling shards of ice and compacted snow from the rough surface. A massive boulder of the same black rock found within this valley rests securely in a narrow divot cut into the ground, covered in narrow gouges that crisscross along its rough surface. In the gentle dusting of snow covering the ground several clawed prints follow the shadows along the edge of the valley leading northward towards the outpost.

node.name: Seord Kerwaith, Crystalline Gorge
node.description: Stones and rubble near the midline of the valley are cleared to make way for the battered remains of a war camp. Battle-worn tents, partially collapsed and decayed from extended exposure to the elements, are arranged in narrow rows around frozen remnants of campfires carved into the ground. The chill wind sporadically sweeps from the heavens to meander though the valley, hitting the frost-covered fabric with a dull rustle.

node.name: Seord Kerwaith, Crystalline Gorge
node.description: The frost-covered remnants of several broken crates rest in a heap along the back valley wall, their weather-worn surfaces painted with a faded blood-red insignia. Small patches of slowly shifting snow rest in wind-lashed drifts. Gentle wisps of white crystals dance across the ground with each errant breeze.

node.name: Seord Kerwaith, Squat Cavern
node.description: The interior of the small cavern is carved from the heart of the black stone, the walls covered with the chiseled gouges of pickaxes. Several shallow stone basins hung on rusted chains from the wall bathe the area in a pale yellow glow. The frigid breeze of the valley outside meets with the unexplainably warm air filling the narrow space, condensing on the wall in crystal-clear droplets of water.

node.name: Cragstone Vale, Tunnel
node.description: Rising steeply from a rough-hewn opening, the passage is large enough for several mounted S'Kra Mur to ride abreast. Gouges of chisels and other marks of excavation abound, but the natural crack splitting the tunnel's ceiling indicates that this was once little more than a natural fissure in the flank of the mountain. The flickering glow of countless torches, affixed to the walls with thick metal brackets, bathe the passage in a pale yellow light.

node.name: Cragstone Vale, Tunnel
node.description: The natural fissure in the ceiling stretches into the darkness high above. Burning torches punctuate the walls of the shaft every ten paces, and their fluttering light casts dancing shadows across the rock. Intermittent gusts of air from below rush upwards, causing the tunnel to reverberate in a guttural moan.

node.name: Cragstone Vale, Shrine of the Shell
node.description: The passage leading from below opens abruptly into a great, domed chamber. The cavern centers on a pillar of black stone bathed in the light from a fissure rising through the ceiling to the sky above. A shrine and brazier sit to one side of the pillar. Blazing torches encircle the chamber, each rising from an intricately rendered, gilt dragon sconce. The red-orange firelight reveals elaborate designs carved across the walls of the vast space.

node.name: Cragstone Vale, Korograth Lair
node.description: The walls of the chasm gradually bow toward each other until they finally embrace, forming a protective arch over the terminus of the canyon. The floor of the enclosure has been quarried to create a ring of colossal depressions where shattered, young mikkhalbamar trunks and rounded stones have been laid as bedding material. Nestled between these korograth roosts, a tunnel mouth leads into the rock face.

node.name: Cragstone Vale, Granite Canyon
node.description: The sheer walls of the defile tower overhead, crowding ever closer together. Only a thin ribbon of sky remains visible through the incomplete arch above. Occasional, rumbling thumps echo from the east and west, causing gravel to cascade to the canyon floor. Strangely, the pathway is clear of fallen rock.

node.name: Cragstone Vale, Granite Canyon
node.description: Over fifty paces in height, the granite walls of this canyon lean toward each other, allowing little light to reach the floor. The near-vertical cliffs and fallen boulders alike have been worn smooth by the action of water, but the accumulation of silt and animal remains indicates that its source has long since been diverted. The skeleton of a massive korograth rises to one side of the path.

node.name: Cragstone Vale, Roadway
node.description: As the open roadway clings to the massive flank of the mountain, the forest seems to glower angrily, its branches clawing for complete dominion of the valley. Only the crushing passage of enormous beasts has kept the mikkhalbamar at bay. A tangled deadfall stretches deep into the trees while a massive crag to the south opens into a narrow canyon walled by sheer cliffs.

node.name: The Black Spire, Gates
node.description: Sheltered under the watchful eye of the mountain, towering walls and craggy parapets rise like a ravenous serpent from the rock that composes this end of the ravine. Wrought of mikkhalbamar and thick, iron bands, the massive gates of the fortress mark the end of the valley road. Silent evidence of battle litters the ground riven siege towers, wrecked onagers and shattered scorpions have been trodden nearly to splinters by time and the footfalls of great beasts.

node.name: Cragstone Vale, Corral
node.description: The mountain's flank flattens, creating a broad ledge between the cliffs above and the forest below. A fence of stout mikkhalbamar logs has been erected around the area to create an enclosure in which the Dragon Priests train their war mounts. Through a massive, open gate to the southeast, the road continues toward the mountain itself.

node.name: Cragstone Vale, Corral
node.description: The mountain's flank flattens, creating a broad ledge between the cliffs above and the forest below. A fence of stout mikkalbamar logs has been erected around the area to create an enclosure in which the Dragon Priests train their war mounts, but some great force has left the barricade in ruins here.

node.name: Cragstone Vale, Corral
node.description: The great trees of the forest have been forced aside to accommodate a twisting path that descends to the northeast. The stout mikkalbamar fence rises tall and sturdy, a perfect cage for the training of the war mounts the Dragon Priests take into battle.

node.name: Cragstone Vale, Corral
node.description: Sheltered under the cliff face, this portion of the enclosure centers on a deep, rocky cleft that leads into a cave in the ravine wall. Heaps of rotting meat fills oversized feeding troughs that flank the opening.

node.name: Cragstone Vale, Roadway
node.description: The overgrown roadway stretches to the southwest, while a section of crushed fence leads to a rocky shelf above. The sound of rushing water can be heard from the north where a huge, fallen tree has been toppled away from the road, creating a narrow void through the underbrush.

node.name: Cragstone Vale, Roadway
node.description: The forest crowds the road as the neglected path winds its way through a depression in the valley floor. Rainwater and mountain snowmelt have eroded a sharp gully that blocks the way westward. No movement comes from the surrounding trees despite an occasional breeze passing through the area.

node.name: Cragstone Vale, Roadway
node.description: An occasional twittering bird breaks the silence of the forest canopy that hangs over this stretch of road. Boughs of mikkhalbamar block most of the sky from view. The pathway widens to the southwest while a rain-washed gully blocks the way east.

node.name: Cragstone Vale, Roadway
node.description: The forest rises to the north of the roadway while the scarred wall of the ravine rises to the south. Some cataclysmic force fractured the cliff face above, causing a tumult of rock and debris to cascade across the road.

node.name: Cragstone Vale, Roadway
node.description: Burned stumps line a path littered with boulders, rocks and chunks of fused slag. The forest appears to shy away from shattered trees that add to the look of devastation. The road continues southwest while a jagged rockslide blocks the way east.

node.name: Cragstone Vale, Roadway
node.description: From this small rise, the surrounding terrain is clearly visible. The river lies to the northwest, while to the northeast a massive rockslide crests across the road as it snakes its way around a buckle in the ravine wall. To the west, the route continues past a collection of pikes displaying sun-bleached skulls capped with Dwarven great helms.

node.name: Cragstone Vale, Roadway
node.description: The road hugs the river, culminating in a bridge that once spanned the flow, leading to the mouth of the valley. Scorched, scarred earthworks are all that now remain of a long abandoned fortification. The great rents in the defenses must have been torn by a devastating force, exposing a massive shard of black rock resting at its heart.

node.name: Seord Kerwaith, Crystalline Gorge
node.description: Resting in the shadow of the Himineldar Shel, the dark pass cuts a treacherous path over snowy slopes to the wilderness of Forfedhdar beyond. With every breath, the freezing mountain air claws at travelers, seeming to steal the warmth from their very lungs. The walls enclose the valley tower high above, its surface glimmering in the available light. A gentle rain of snow and ice cascade from the mountain summit high above, dusting the area with a light powdering of pristine snow.

node.name: Cragstone Vale, Broken Bridge
node.description: The smooth, grey stones of the bridge end abruptly in a blackened chaos of splintered rock. Luckily, the foundations remain strong enough to support the remaining span of ten paces above the hubbub of rushing water. The faint scent of sulfur still rises whenever the air stills.

node.name: Cragstone Vale, Entrance
node.description: Overgrown and badly in need of repair, the rarely used roadway ends abruptly at a small river. Massive branches reach across the water, seeking an area free of other trees. Thick vines hang down from them, as if stretching for the water below. The end of one hangs close enough to the shore to touch. Across the river, mikkhalbamar grow tall and tangled, as if fighting each other for space as their branches intertwine.

node.name: Zaldi Taipa, Kurtz's Gems
node.description: Purple-tinted silk has been draped haphazardly over a collection of hide-covered chests, creating a counter area for the gem dealer to work upon. Heavy clay jars line the tent wall behind the chests in a tidy row, in vivid contrast to the rest of the chadir, which is filled with several unpacked trunks, bags, and rolls of hide.

node.name: Cragstone Vale, Mikkhalbamar Canopy
node.description: High up in the canopy, it is hard to tell where a branch from one mikkhalbamar ends and one from another starts. The neighboring trees grow in and through each other's foliage. The only thing that helps indicate direction is the river rushing by far below.

arc.move: rt swing to east on vine
rt swing to southeast on vine

node.name: Cragstone Vale, Mikkhalbamar Canopy
node.description: The multitude of branches twisting and turning in every direction possible has a dizzying effect on travelers not used to this forest. To those traversing this route, getting lost is more of a concern than falling. The only thing that helps indicate direction is the muted sound of the river to the north and northwest.

arc.move: rt swing to west on vine
rt swing to south on vine
rt swing to northeast on vine

node.name: Cragstone Vale, Mikkhalbamar Canopy
node.description: Massive branches, wide enough to accommodate two large Gor'Togs walking abreast with room to spare, make traversing the trees easy. The only thing that helps indicate direction is the sound of the river to the north and northwest.

arc.move: rt swing to north on vine
rt swing to northwest on vine
rt swing to southeast on vine

node.name: Cragstone Vale, Mikkhalbamar Canopy
node.description: Broad and sturdy, the branches provide easy access through the trees. There is little risk of falling and scrapes from the stone-like bark are the lone danger here, at least from the trees. The only thing that helps indicate direction is the muted sound of the river to the north and northwest.

arc.move: rt swing to northwest on vine
rt swing to northeast on vine

node.name: Cragstone Vale, Mikkhalbamar Canopy
node.description: High up in the canopy, it is hard to tell where a branch from one tree ends and one from another starts as the neighboring trees grow in and through each other's foliage. The only thing that helps indicate direction is the muted sound of the river to the north and northwest.

arc.move: rt swing to southwest on vine
rt swing to north on vine
rt swing to east on vine

The only thing that helps indicate direction is the muted sound of the river to the north and northwest.

arc.move: rt swing to south on vine
rt swing to northwest on vine

node.name: Cragstone Vale, Mikkhalbamar Canopy
node.description: Tangles of branches form a nearly solid platform underfoot. Little is visible here, save for the tops of the grey-black trees that form this immense forest. The sound of rushing water drifts over from the north and northwest.

arc.move: rt swing to southeast on vine
rt swing to southwest on vine

node.name: Cragstone Vale, Mikkhalbamar Canopy
node.description: The multitude of branches twisting and turning in every direction possible has a dizzying effect on travelers not used to this forest. To those traversing this route, getting lost is more of a concern than falling. The only thing that helps indicate direction is the muted sound of the river to the north. The roar of a waterfall can be heard to the northeast.

rt swing to south on vine
rt swing to east on vine

The only thing that helps indicate direction is the muted sound of the river to the north. The roar of a waterfall can be heard to the northeast.

arc.move: rt swing to west on vine
rt swing to east on vine
rt swing to northeast on vine

node.name: Cragstone Vale, Mikkhalbamar Canopy
node.description: The walls of the ravine can be seen through the foliage, towering grandly above the trees. Branches intertwine, seeking any available space to grow, making it hard to tell where a branch from one tree ends and another starts. The roar from the waterfall to the northeast is diminished here.

arc.move: rt swing to west on vine
rt swing to north on vine
rt swing to northeast on vine
rt swing to south on vine
rt swing to northwest on vine

node.name: Cragstone Vale, Waterfall
node.description: The roar of the nearby waterfall nearly drowns out all other sound as it comes crashing down. Strong currents tug at those foolish enough to enter these waters, threatening to take the unwary with them as they rush back towards the pool and river beyond. Mist from the cascade gives the feel of perpetual rain as it drenches everything in the area. Nearby, a rocky shore can barely be seen through the mist.

arc.move: rt swing to south on vine

node.name: Cragstone Vale, Rocky Shore
node.description: The roar of the nearby waterfall nearly drowns out all other sound as it comes crashing down. Mist from the cascade gives the feel of perpetual rain as it drenches everything in the area. A twisting path leads away from the shore to disappear in the thick growth of trees.

node.name: Cragstone Vale, Mikkhalbamar Canopy
node.description: The multitude of branches twisting and turning in every direction possible has a dizzying effect on travelers not used to this forest. To those traversing this route, getting lost is more of a concern than falling. A large, turbulent pool caused by the nearby waterfall lies far below. The constant mist makes the branches slippery and treacherous to navigate.

arc.move: rt swing to north on vine
rt swing to south on vine

node.name: Cragstone Vale, Mikkhalbamar Canopy
node.description: Massive branches, wide enough to accommodate two large Gor'Togs walking abreast with room to spare, make traversing the trees easy. The only thing that helps indicate direction is the roar of a waterfall that can be heard to the northeast.

arc.move: rt swing to southwest on vine
rt swing to north on vine

node.name: Cragstone Vale, Mikkhalbamar Canopy
node.description: High up in the branches, it is hard to tell where a branch from one tree ends and one from another starts as the neighboring trees wind in and through each other's foliage. To the east and south, the sides of the ravine rise up above the treetops. Many of the branches climb toward the mountainside only to turn away, seeking another route to grow.

arc.move: rt swing to north on vine
rt swing to northeast on vine
rt swing to south on vine
rt swing to northwest on vine

node.description: High up in the branches, it is hard to tell where a branch from one tree ends and one from another starts as the neighboring trees grow in and through each other's foliage. A large, turbulent pool caused by the nearby waterfall lies far below. The constant mist makes the branches slippery and treacherous to navigate.

arc.move: rt swing to southwest on vine

node.name: Cragstone Vale, Deadfall
node.description: In years past, two mikkhalbamar trees fell, their branches enmeshed as if grabbing onto each other in an attempt to remain upright, creating this sheltered locale. A sense of safety fills the area, as the larger and less nimble beasts of the woods are unable to penetrate the tangled deadfall. Though not completely weatherproof, the still-living branches do give some protection from the sometimes violent storms that pass through the ravine. A storm-split branch provides access to the trees above.

node.name: Cragstone Vale, Bramble Snarl
node.description: Mikkhalbamar tower majestically overhead, the lowest branches twice the height of a Gor'Tog from the ground. The only exception is one very low hanging branch. A thick growth of thorny brush not only blocks the view, but also makes navigation nearly impossible. Some torn cloth flutters from a nearby bush.

node.name: Cragstone Vale, Bramble Snarl
node.description: Mikkhalbamar trees tower majestically overhead, the lowest branches twice the height of a Gor'Tog from the ground. A thick growth of thorny brush not only blocks the view, but also makes navigation nearly impossible. Bodies, in various states of decay, have been impaled on some of the thorns, whether in punishment or some macabre ritual, it is impossible to tell.

node.name: Cragstone Vale, Bramble Snarl
node.description: Mikkhalbamar trees tower majestically overhead, the lowest branches twice the height of a Gor'Tog from the ground. A thick growth of thorny brush not only blocks the view, but also makes navigation nearly impossible. Bodies, in various states of decay, have been impaled on some of the thorns, whether in punishment or some macabre ritual, it is impossible to tell.

node.description: Mikkhalbamar trees tower majestically overhead, the lowest branches twice the height of a Gor'Tog from the ground. node.name: Cragstone Vale, Bramble Snarl
node.description: Mikkhalbamar trees tower majestically overhead, the lowest branches twice the height of a Gor'Tog from the ground. A thick growth of thorny brush not only blocks the view, but also makes navigation nearly impossible. Bodies, in various states of decay, have been impaled on some of the thorns, whether in punishment or some macabre ritual, it is impossible to tell.

node.name: Raven's Point, Gear Gate
node.description: The massive gear gate is a flurry of constant motion as war-worn generals dressed in bulky suits of ornamental armor bark orders at the legions of soldiers, prepared to defend the outpost at a moment's notice. Countless Forfedhdarian archers stationed on the towers keep a careful watch on the southern pass. A squat stone building with a sturdy door covered in pelts rests amidst the ramshackle hovels, its double-wide red brick chimney spouting a curling pillar of inky black smoke.

node.name: The Black Spire, Chamber of Blood
node.description: Blazing torches punctuate the exterior wall of the chamber, lighting the rows of brightly burnished weapons and polished armor that rest in simple racks against the remaining three walls. Ranks of stout shields hang from hooks beneath the torch sconces. Ripples of dry heat emanate from the smoldering coals within a great iron brazier cast in the shape of a roaring dragon's maw.

node.name: The Black Spire, Chamber of Blood
node.description: Sibilating torches spread an eerie glow across the soot-stained, stone walls of this long practice room. Murals, depicting an army of zealots descending upon a band of Ru'atin Peri'el, stretch opposite an expansive tapestry depicting Dzree. The dark stains that speckle the stone floor offer testament to the zealots' use of live steel for their practice sessions.

node.name: The Black Spire, Chamber of Blood
node.description: The dark masonry of the exterior wall abruptly gives way to the jagged, living rock into which the fortress has been built. Training mannequins, rendered in various shapes and sizes, populate this room. Between the scarred figures, sets of painted, concentric circles on the floor guide novice zealots while practicing their footwork and forms. Upon the walls, dozens of parchment drawings illustrate the precise technique of different combat maneuvers.

node.name: The Black Spire, Chamber of Blood
node.description: Scattered, sputtering oil lamps cast barely enough light to navigate the space. Rows of raised, masonry sandpits stretch the length of the room. Those nearest the cliff face are small and lined with white sand suited to young, supple scales. As the sandpits graduate to an adult size, they are lined with a mixture of coarse sand and crushed rock designed to harden their occupants, body and soul.

node.name: The Black Spire, Shrine of the Fang
node.description: The center of the chamber is dominated by a wickedly curved dragon fang carved from a single piece of deadly sharp obsidian. Standing over a pace tall, the fang erupts from the floor within a circle of flickering, scarlet candles. The accumulated wax surrounding the cuspidate stone creates the illusion of living flesh.

node.name: The Black Spire, Entry Hall
node.description: Lit by lamps in stands placed in the corners, this somewhat square room is lined with trophies of past conquest. Suits of Dwarven mail and old-styled armor from the other races have been set on stands. Weapons and banners captured from various houses and cultures adorn the walls. A large, serrated sword hangs over an arch of black obsidian. A raised portcullis leads to the gatehouse.

node.name: The Black Spire, The Halls of Insanity
node.description: Half of the room has been caged off, restricting access. Within the iron cage, several iron-banded barrels line one of the stone walls. Half of the containers are filled with dragon-pommeled shh'oi'latas, while the other is half filled with bulging, leather belt pouches. Steel hooks are attached to the ceiling, each holding a single piece of scale armor embellished with the image of a sleeping black dragon. The only items not under lock are dozens of obsidian amulets that line one of the walls.

node.name: The Halls Of Insanity, Scale Shrine
node.description: This circular grey stone chamber is lit by several torches that glow brightly within their niches. Rising from the center of the room is an obsidian altar painstakingly carved to resemble a deep black dragon scale. Small lines of blood, both fresh and dry, run down the slab in various areas.

node.name: The Black Spire, The Halls of Insanity
node.description: The mingling odors of smoke and dried blood immediately assault the nose. The poorly lit room is punctuated with dozens of small drab stone desks. Each desk is surrounded on three sides by thick, granite slabs. Most of the desks have large, misshapen patterns of dried blood that mingle with a black, powdery substance.

node.name: The Black Spire, The Halls of Insanity
node.description: Thin wisps of smoke rise from several braziers, giving the room a musty odor. Thick wooden stilts support a mikkhalbamar loft, dividing the room into two separate levels. A deep layer of sand covers both floors which the juggernauts use as sandpits. Painted throughout the room are images of Peri'el lulling the World Dragon in an endless slumber, the last thing the juggernauts see when they sleep at night and their first sight upon waking.

node.name: The Black Spire, The Halls of Insanity
node.description: The smell of death and blood permeates the air. The remains of two Dwarves lie against the back wall, one still in the chains holding him into a standing position. Fresh blood is splattered against the back wall, and the other three have their share of older, dried stains. Deep gashes have been cut into the stone walls giving testament to the strength of both the juggernauts and the shh'oiatas they wield. Painted on the ceiling is a massive black dragon.

node.name: The Halls Of Insanity, Scale Shrine
node.description: Several torches that glow brightly within their niches light this circular grey stone chamber. Rising from the center of the room is a huge slab of obsidian, painstakingly carved to resemble a deep-black scale. Small lines of blood, both fresh and dry, run down the slab in various areas.

node.name: The Halls Of Insanity, Armory
node.description: Half of the room has been caged off, restricting access. Within the iron cage, several iron-banded barrels line one of the stone walls. Half of the containers are filled with dragon-pommeled shh'oiatas, while the other is half filled with bulging, leather belt pouches. Steel hooks are attached to the ceiling, each holding a single piece of scale armor embellished with the image of a sleeping black dragon. The only items not under lock are dozens of obsidian amulets, which line one of the walls.

node.name: The Black Spire, Guard Room
node.description: A single table surrounded with chairs dominates this utilitarian room. Near the passage to the gatehouse sits a battered chest full of arrows and a dented rack holding pole arms and swords. In one corner, a heavy ladder leads up through a hole in the ceiling.

node.name: The Black Spire, Gatehouse
node.description: Unadorned except for two large torches in plain iron holders, the gatehouse is empty and clear of debris. Many years of tramping boots have worn a smooth path across the flat stones of the floor. Thick, iron-banded gates, made of dense mikkhalbamar, provide an exit to the valley. A stout crossbeam sits nearby, ready to secure them against invasion. Two openings and a raised portcullis lead further into the fortress.

node.name: The Black Spire, Guard Room
node.description: A single table surrounded with chairs dominates this utilitarian room. Near the passage to the gatehouse sits a battered chest full of arrows and a dented rack holding pole arms and swords. In one corner, a heavy ladder leads up through a hole in the ceiling.

node.name: The Black Spire, Great Hall
node.description: Dark and cavernous, the hall is clearly intended to accommodate all the residents of the fortress. The floor is covered with a mosaic of multicolored tiles depicting the World Dragon menacing the orb of Elanthia. Several benches sit to one side beside a raised platform. Behind it, a large mural fills the entire wall and S'Kra Mur clan banners hang from the ceiling.

node.name: The Black Spire, Mess Hall
node.description: Orderly rows of tables and chairs fill this room. On one wall, near the exit to the Great Hall, a list of daily duties and patrol routes has been posted. A lectern stands in a corner next to a mounted slate board, which has been wiped clean.

node.name: The Black Spire, Storeroom
node.description: More a natural cavern than a constructed room, the storeroom contains rows of shelves holding grains and dried vegetables. Barrels of ale and wine and crates filled with dried meats are stacked next to a large stone cistern. The sound of slowly flowing water fills the room.

node.name: The Black Spire, Kitchen
node.description: A large hearth has been carved into the rock of the cliff face creating a deep, wide cooking space. Hanging from a thick, iron lug pole, a large pot contains a bubbling, noxious concoction. Centered in the room, a large table is heaped with vegetables and meats in various states of freshness. Pots and pans sit in stacks underneath.

node.name: The Black Spire, Upstairs Hall
node.description: Large and unadorned by furniture, the hall serves as a rallying point for this section of the fortress. The darkness here is broken only by the occasional flickering lamp suspended from claw-shaped hooks. A set of double doors open out to the parapet and a narrow corridor leads southeast.

node.name: The Black Spire, Corridor
node.description: Dimly lit by a lone torch, the corridor looks like something out of a Gnomish nightmare. Rocky protuberances shaped like teeth line the sides of the floor and ceiling. All surfaces are painted to enhance the illusion of being inside a dragon's maw.

node.name: The Black Spire, Stairwell
node.description: The air, thick with smoke from dim oil lamps, is filled with the acrid odor of incense. Stone steps rise into the gloom and descend to an oak door. A dark shaft stretches upwards into shadow at the center of the tower.

node.name: The Black Spire, Stairwell
node.description: The landing gives a good view of the stone steps that continue to wind up and down around the tower's central core. Iron manacles attached to pins in the stone walls hang unused in the still air.

node.name: The Black Spire, Stairwell
node.description: The central core of the tower descends with a stone stair spiraling down its length. A very steep stairway cuts directly across the precipitous drop to an opening in the lower floor's ceiling. The risers show the marks and scratches of something being dragged up and down.

node.name: The Black Spire, Temple of the World Dragon
node.description: The smell of incense is intense and choking in this circular chamber at the top of the tower. Numerous black candles cast a flickering light over a large block of black stone. The image of the World Dragon, meticulously carved in granite, supports the altar in its giant maw. Plain, wooden kneelers have been placed in front of a large tapestry that covers the opposite wall.

node.name: The Black Spire, Chamber of Death
node.description: Oddly shaped to fit along the curved tower walls, chairs surround a modest table in the center of the room. Pitted and marked by the points of countless knives, it is bare except for an elegantly detailed deobar box. Near the table, an open chest contains short swords, serrated daggers, sharp pointed knives and bucklers of varying styles.

node.name: The Black Spire, Chamber of Death
node.description: Two desks covered with parchments sit against the outer, curved wall of the room. Ragged carpets soften the hard stone of the floor. In the corner, a modified distillation apparatus, the glass blown in the shape of a coiled dragon, sits on top of a small, unlit stove.

node.name: The Black Spire, Chamber of Death
node.description: The dormitory consists of triple rows of three-high bunk beds placed to take advantage of all available floor space. Each bunk is filled with coarse black sand. An iron stove keeps the room at a high temperature.

node.name: The Black Spire, Chamber of Pain
node.description: Plain racks line the thick, stone walls each filled with various types of swords and shields, some of which appear unused. Bottles of various innocuous-smelling potions with no labels fill the stone shelves that seem to emerge from the wall. A small, scorched framed window looks out on the forest below.

node.name: The Black Spire, Chamber of Pain
node.description: Along one wall are rows upon rows of bookcases that are filled with manuscripts on the history of the Dragon Priests and magic. Nearby is a large desk filled with various ingredients and alchemy tools, above this are shelves filled with books on making potions. Sketches adorn the wall and depict the various manipulations of nature that dwell in the forest below and serve the priests.

node.name: The Black Spire, Chamber of Pain
node.description: Rows of sandpits and woven mats hug the dark stone walls of the dimly lit room. A small window near the door is the only light source, save for a crooked torch mounted nearby. Sparsely decorated, there are only a few chests here for the storage of clothing.

node.name: The Black Spire, Shrine of the Flame
node.description: The area is dominated by a large eye-shaped skylight that seems to be mounted atop a pillar of pure fire that fills the room with an intense heat. A large metal shutter opens and closes with the billows of smoke, making the skylight seem as though it is alive and blinking while watching the occupants in the room below. Words are carved into the walls around the room.

node.name: The Black Spire, Chamber of Pain
node.description: The far wall is dominated by a bookcase of tomes written by the Crones to detail the history of this sect of the Dragon Priests. In the center of the room is a distorted mikkhalbamar desk with sheets of strange skin-like parchment and writing implements, whilst the focal point of the desk is a large book. The floor is carved with images of the World Dragon. A mouth-shaped window looks out on the forest.

node.name: The Black Spire, Halls of Suffering
node.description: Restless flames from several torches illuminate the walls and send fitful shadows across the room. Two walls are lined with tall racks that accommodate a large assortment of well-kept bows. A third wall is studded with small wooden pegs from which hang dozens of quivers full of arrows.

node.name: The Black Spire, Halls of Suffering
node.description: Benches and tables are scattered throughout the area, and the floor is littered with wood shavings and bits of feathers. Jars of oils and polish are strewn across the tables. Reed baskets filled with assorted flights and bowstrings sit on shelves that line one of the walls. On another, quivers, stocked with sticks of various types of woods hang on pegs.

node.name: The Black Spire, Halls of Suffering
node.description: At first glance, the room seems to be full of oddly shaped mounds, but the sparse torchlight reveals them to be raised sandpits. Surrounding a dimly lit brazier in the center of the room, smaller sandpits for the young are kept closest to the warmth. Larger ones are scattered in a protective circle around them.

node.name: The Black Spire, Shrine of the Talon
node.description: A large, cast iron brazier lights the center of the large chamber. The sanguine glow of the flames caresses a brutally sharp, black-lacquered talon of mikkhalbamar that rises about Dwarf height from a sunken pedestal in the center of an external wall. A shallow trench in the stone floor surrounds the base and terminates in the wall to either side of the sculpture. A large, eye-shaped skylight peers up toward the World Dragon Temple high above.

node.name: The Black Spire, Halls of Suffering
node.description: Arrow slits and torches on an external wall supply light for this training room. Woven reed wrestling mats cover the stone floor. Against one of the walls are mounted wooden boards marked with what appears to be the outlines of Dwarves. The figures are heavily scarred in the vital areas.

node.name: The Black Spire, Parapet
node.description: The northern end of the parapet juts out toward the nearby forest, which has been clear cut some distance from the fortress' foundations. The thick canopy of green leaves sways with the air currents flowing from the crashing waterfall not far away.

node.name: The Black Spire, Parapet
node.description: The parapet ends close to the steep ravine wall, heightening the defenses of the fortress. Jagged rock protects the southern flank of the stronghold and the crenellations afford an unobstructed view to the massive corral in the distance.

node.name: The Black Spire, Parapet
node.description: The balcony stretches the entire front length of the fortress. Wide crenellations give excellent vantage points to all approaches. Several large pots, containing viscous oil and tar, sit nearby and are ready to be dropped on would-be invaders threatening the front gates.

node.name: Hrendh Skogar
node.description: This twisting path has been created over the years by the migration of animals. Foliage deep green in coloration outlines the rough roadway, dwarfed by the massive trees that tower high above. The faint smell of lilac and pine drifts causally though the air, filling the wood with the gentle aroma.

node.name: Gilen Otso Steppes, Prairie Grove
node.description: A gentle breeze whispers through this small space, lightly ruffling the tendrils of the thick emerald green moss that covers the ground like a rich velvet cloak. The canopy of leaves close in protectively above, allowing only a small patch of night sky to be visible. Emerging from the shadows, a masterfully carved totem in the image of an antelope guards a fine-grained ash altar from any peril the darkness may bring.

A gentle breeze whispers through this small space, lightly ruffling the tendrils of the thick emerald green moss that covers the ground like a rich velvet cloak. The canopy of leaves close in protectively above, allowing only a single shaft of light to filter through onto a tall totem, masterfully carved in the image of an antelope. Reflected light from the lifelike creature is focused upon a fine-grained ash altar, settled in the bed of moss directly in front of the figure.

node.name: Gilen Otso Steppes, Oasis
node.description: Crystal clear water trickles down a shallow trench in a rock like a miniature fountain, shaped over many long years of erosion. No pool forms however -- the emerald green moss greedily soaks up every drop like a sponge, causing it to grow more densely at the end of the stream. A detailed totem carved in the image of an antelope bows toward the thick moss, as if daintily nibbling the velvety plant.

node.name: Wyvern Trail, Narrow Path
node.description: To the east, sunlight glints off the surface of the lake which surrounds the city of Shard. This near the shore, the narrow footpath is muddy, clinging tenaciously to the boots of those who travel it. A squishing sound fills the air with each footstep along the path. The path stretches out to the west, away from the main road leading to Shard.

Moonlight reflects off the five towers which dominate the city of Shard, providing a beacon for travelers in the night. The rhythmic lapping of waves against the lake shore mixes with the squelching sound of boots struggling to free themselves from the mud of the trail with each footstep. The trail stretches onward to the west, away from the main road which leads toward Shard.

node.name: Wyvern Trail, Narrow Path
node.description: The trail is firm beneath the feet of the traveler as it winds its way through the farmlands which support the city of Shard. The rich brown soil is perfect for growing grains and fruit, as well as other delicacies to tempt the jaded palate of the city dwellers.

node.name: Wyvern Trail, Narrow Path
node.description: Fields lie fallow and overgrown by weeds, the farms abandoned to time and the wind. With each step, a small cloud of dust rises into the air to hang there for a moment before dispersing.

node.name: Wyvern Trail, Narrow Path
node.description: Tangled scrub brush gives way to taller trees as the trail continues through a forest. Gnarled branches clutch at the clothing of those who journey, traveling ever onward toward their final destination.

node.name: Wyvern Trail, Narrow Path
node.description: The trail is rugged here as it climbs over the rocky terrain near Wyvern Mountain. Dense brush surrounds the trail on all sides as travelers walk warily, lest a wrenched ankle turn the long journey into an agonizing one.

node.name: Wyvern Trail, Clearing
node.description: Tangled brush surrounds a small clearing on all sides, save for a narrow trail which leads east. Next to the trail lies the twisted remains of a once mighty oak tree, its limbs shattered, its trunk blackened by fire. A faint smell of charred woodsmoke hangs on the still air to tickle the senses. Footprints criss-cross the clearing between the trail and a particularly rough patch of brush.

Tangled brush surrounds this small clearing on all sides, save for a narrow trail which leads east. Next to the trail lie the twisted remains of a once mighty oak tree, phosphorescent lichen glowing faintly from its blackened trunk. A faint smell of charred woodsmoke hangs on the still air to tickle the senses. Footprints criss-cross the clearing between the trail and a particularly rough patch of brush.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Cavern
node.description: Light passes through cracks in the roof of the cavern to reflect silently off the piles of gems and jewelry which lie heaped before a finely-crafted statue of a Dwarven man. Golden leprechauns scamper over the piles of treasure, the natural guardians of such a booty. An onyx raven seems to watch the leprechaun's antics with an expression of detached amusement.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Cavern
node.description: Light shines throughout the cavern from a crack in the ceiling. It falls upon a tapestry of a young maiden walking next to a pure white unicorn, which hangs against the rocky walls. Heaped high before the tapestry are sheaves of wheat and ripe fruit, while healing herbs fill wicker baskets on the floor.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Cavern
node.description: Wooden shelves, cracking in the dampness from the cave, line the walls of the room. Books have been piled on every available surface, from grimoires filled with cryptic spells, to a rather sappy epic penned by a young bard. In the center of the room stands a statue of an aloof Elothean male, a black ironwood wolf at his side.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Cavern
node.description: Knives and daggers are mounted on the walls of this cavern, surrounding a mural of an Elven man with ebon skin and long black hair flecked with strands of silver. A night-black panther stalks by his side. Beneath the mural is a small statue of a sleeping child, a peaceful smile on his marble lips.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Cavern
node.description: Swords and armor lie piled haphazardly on racks in this room, surrounding a statue of a wild-haired warrior attended by several youths and maidens. A feral smile lights the statue's face as it seems to gaze at those who pass through the cavern. A stone boar snuffles at the feet of the warrior, the carved bristles and fangs sharply detailed.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Cavern
node.description: A mural on the wall is bordered by statues of a human and Halfling child. The mural depicts a human man in the prime of life, full of health and vigor, watching over a green field in which children play. Though an indulgent amusement lights his eyes, something about the set of his jaw indicates that his indulgence is tempered with steel. An ox stands by his side, calmly chewing the grass of the field.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Cavern
node.description: Veins of gold and precious gems glitter from the walls of the cave, reflecting what little light exists here. In the center of the cave, a statue of a S'kra Mur male has been sculpted from the stalagmites which litter the floor of the cavern, scorning any foreign marble or granite. A stone cobra rears up before him, hood spread wide and fangs bared in a sibilant hiss of wind.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Dragon Shrine
node.description: Six carved columns of pale marble support an enormous vaulted ceiling. Silvery sand covers the floor, while an enormous dragon, carved of smoky black quartz, lies in the center of the room. The unknown artist who carved the creature depicted it asleep, curled about a jasper globe. Next to it sits a white marble statue of a S'kra Mur woman of twisted body yet serene expression. An open flame burns on an altar on a raised dais near the globe.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Cavern
node.description: Water splashes in an underground pool, reflecting dancing rays of light off the cavern's walls and ceilings. Some acoustical trick makes the splashing of water sound like a chittering sea mammal, lending realism to an exquisitely carved grey marble dolphin which swims beside the statue of an Elothean maiden within the clear water of the pool.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Cavern
node.description: A tubby little man perches atop a worn wooden table in a fresco on the wall of the cave, a mug of ale in hand. His eyes are filled with merriment as he surveys a band of dancing Halflings frolicking about the room, while older Halflings play on various instruments. A ram reaches out from behind a keg to snarfle a tart from the piles of pastries, sandwiches and ale heaped high upon the table.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Cavern
node.description: A tabby cat lies purring before an open hearth in a charming painting of a young housewife resting in a rocker. A half-finished tapestry of consummate craftsmanship is shown threaded on an upright loom beside her, while a spinning wheel, churn and various other domestic implements are neatly stored in her tiny cottage. In the cavern, wooden tables are piled high with homely gifts of ale and butter, bolts of cloth and spools of thread, humble offerings to a gentle goddess.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Cavern
node.description: Embroidered silk panels flutter from the ceiling with every passing breeze, each depicting a slender green-eyed Elven woman with glowing brown hair. One shows her dancing, another depicts her playing a harp, while still another shows her apparently talking to a wren perched upon her outstretched finger. Mischievous sprites and other creatures of Faerie flutter about her, faint images in the panels' backgrounds.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Cavern
node.description: A painted triptych hangs on the wall of the cavern. The center panel depicts a golden-haired man wielding a gleaming greatsword, his only shield, an olive laurel. Fine linen covers his eyes, yet lack of sight seems no impediment as he battles his unseen foe. On his right is a painting of a group of kings, judges and wise men, while on his left hand, a tawny lion seems ready to step out of the panel and shake his shaggy mane.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Raised Dais
node.description: The view atop the raised dais is impressive, gazing into the dragon's yawning maw. The artist faceted each individual dragon scale on the smokey black quartz beast, causing them to glitter as they reflect the light. Flames flicker above a white marble altar, though neither wick nor candle may be seen. The overall impression is one of awe, and perhaps... fear.

node.name: Foot of Wyvern Mountain, Faint Trail
node.description: A small stream from the north crisscrosses a faint trail that leads towards the base of Wyvern Mountain. Partially overgrown with bushes and littered with pinecones from the surrounding trees, the winding path is barely discernible, as if utilized by only the smallest of animals. The stream continues its meandering as it trickles down a rockslide to the road below.

node.name: Foot of Wyvern Mountain, Clearing
node.description: Nestled at the base of the mountain rests a small pool, steam languidly rising from its murky depths. Tiny clumps of wild flowers and fragrant herbs circle the rim, mingling with the warm moisture and enriching the air with their scent. Twining upwards along the mountain wall are dense clumps of prickly bushes and thick-stemmed vines.

node.name: Foot of Wyvern Mountain, Hot Springs
node.description: Tiny ripples lap gently against surrounding stone as the slightest movement causes small wavering swells in the hot springs. The steamy water is very warm, soothing battle-weary bones and everyday aches and pains. This euphoria, coupled with the heady aroma from the surrounding foliage, makes weary trespassers hesitant to leave.

node.name: Foot of Wyvern Mountain, Cavern
node.description: It's pitch dark and you can't see a thing!

A hissing wind blows through the small opening into the cave, echoing eerily throughout the fairly large cavern. A crude brazier sits in the corner, a collection of pine limbs stacked neatly beside it. Along one wall, an assortment of odd-shaped boulders piled upon each other like a crude ladder lead up to a thick ledge jutting from the sleek cavern wall.

node.name: Foot of Wyvern Mountain, Thick Ledge
node.description: The large boulders from below give way to small stones and rocks scattered haphazardly onto a thick ledge that opens into a hollowed-out area. Large enough for even the tallest Gor'Tog to stand upright, it appears the deep scratches and jagged gouges in the surrounding walls were hewn by mortal hand. A flickering wall torch casts a feeble light over a pine altar sitting flush against the back wall.

node.name: Dragon's Spine, Twisting Trail
node.description: A narrow route makes its way up a sharp slope through the dark forest, and sounds of nocturnal animals occasionally break the silence. Flat areas scattered along the path offer a brief respite from the climb, from which patches of Wyvern Road can be glimpsed below.

A narrow route makes its way up a sharp slope through the forest, daylight managing to escape through the trees at broken intervals. Flat areas scattered along the path offer a brief respite from the climb, from which patches of Wyvern Road can be glimpsed below.

node.name: Crystal Forest, Frozen Glade
node.description: The lush greenery of lower thickets abruptly gives way to a pale petrified wood as the path winds along the mountain. Snow hangs over the trees throughout the year at this altitude, glistening in the daylight. Sounds of running water can be heard from a stream at the opposite end of the glade, pouring down from further up the mountain.

The lush greenery of lower thickets abruptly gives way to a pale petrified wood as the path winds along the mountain. Sounds of hunting owls echo through the night air, occasionally accompanied by brief squeals as they find their marks. A running stream can be heard at the opposite end of the glade as the water travels downward from further up the mountain.

node.name: Crystal Forest, Frozen Glade
node.description: Black leaves crunch underfoot, breaking the palpable silence with their icy condensation. The trickling sound of water alludes to the snow melting all around the underbrush. Shielded by thick pines, the homes stretch further into the forest, gaining some extra security from the darkness.

Mottled leaves crunch underfoot, not because they are dry and dead, but rather as a result of the intense accumulation of icy condensation. Rivulets of melting snow burrow through the underbrush to compound the damp, slippery surface. Shielded by thick pines, the homes stretch further into the forest.

node.name: Crystal Forest, Frozen Glade
node.description: Downy snow weighs down the pine boughs along the borders of the meadow, gradually slipping cold, wet surprises onto the flora and fauna below. On several nearby tree trunks, deep gouges are evident, perhaps the work of an adventurous mountain cat shredding the bark as he climbs. Though no visible paw prints mark the forest floor, curious rumbles in the distance keep the natural inhabitants awake and alert.

Heavy snow weighs down the pine boughs along the borders of the meadow, and dull plops from fallen clumps disrupt the night atmosphere. Nocturnal birds flit through the trees, ignoring the chilly winds to seek comfort and companionship among the branches. Trunks as thick as boulders promise an imposing defense for their loyal inhabitants.

node.name: Crystal Forest, Gishen Clemois
node.description: A small pond sits in the middle of this extensive clearing, a rest stop for the stream's descent through the Dragon's Spine. Two structures loom in the darkness on either side like ghostly towers amongst the snow. At the far side of the area, a statue's shadowed silhouette looms from under the canopy.

An extensive area has been deforested to support two large structures among this frosty paradise high in the Dragon's Spine. In the center of the clearing, steam rises from a small pond as a stream rests here before starting its long trek down the hills. At the far side, a statue of lifesculpted granite stands watch under the encroaching canopy.

node.name: Crystal Forest, Secluded Clearing
node.description: Perched high in the mountains, a clearing surrounded by thick snow-covered trees provides a breathtaking view. In spite of constantly frigid conditions, the sound of a short waterfall gives way to a swift unfrozen stream which rushes down a nearby slope and away from the icy summit. Steam rises from the water, evidence to its origin beneath the bitter surface of the Dragon's Spine, and bits of precious vegetation hold onto life in the damp ground.

Perched high in the mountains, a shadowy clearing surrounded by thick snow-covered trees provides a breathtaking view. In spite of constantly frigid conditions compounded by the night's chill, the sound of a short waterfall gives way to a swift, unfrozen stream which rushes down a nearby slope and away from the icy summit. Steam rises into the darkness above the water, evidence to its origin beneath the bitter surface of the Dragon's Spine, and precious vegetation holds onto life in the damp ground.

node.name: Crystal Forest, Secluded Clearing
node.description: Deceptive patches of ice coat the ground, nearly invisible in the darkness under the dense canopy. The forest teems with arboreal beauty, though most of the wildlife is cloaked by night's silken embrace. Homes blend seamlessly into the adjacent trees so as to not disrupt the environment's enchanting mystique.

Patches of ice upon the mossy ground glimmer under the soft daylight filtered by the dense canopy. The forest teems with arboreal beauty, and the trailblazers of yore successfully carved a niche for connoisseurs of nature who wished to claim a more permanent residence. Homes blend aesthetically with the adjacent plant life so as to not disrupt the environment's enchanting mystique.

node.name: Crystal Forest, Secluded Clearing
node.description: Dark ferns cluster close to the ground around the burgeoning aspens as if afraid of the night's oppression. Muted clinking sounds emanate from the underbrush, filling the cold air with peculiar rhythms. A large felled tree occupies a significant amount of space in the clearing, undoubtedly a suitable place for one to sit and watch the stars.

Slender ferns cluster close to the ground around the burgeoning aspens, the plants' needle-like leaves transformed into icicles in the harsh mountain chill. Tiny animals traversing the underbrush cause the stems to wobble, and the hardened fronds clink together like frozen chimes. A large felled tree occupies a significant amount of space in the clearing and undoubtedly provides many safe hiding places for tunneling insects.

node.name: Dragon's Spine, Rivyn's Rise
node.description: From this towering vantage, it is easy to see just how colossal the Dragon's Spine -- and how expansive Greater Ilithi -- really is. The treetops seem to fall for eternity like frozen tears into the basin of Wyvern Road far below, while the city of Shard floats, as if by some magic, on its lake to the southeast. Deep to the south, the mountains and valleys swallowed by the Dark Hand appear to move with an unnatural life as the corrupted child of Nature waits for its moment to expand again.

node.name: Hrendh Skogar, Barrier
