node.description: The faint scent of pine is carried upon the air ever so slightly. Small squirrels scamper along the edge of the path, searching for any stray bits of food accidentally left behind. A large wooden barrier, painted with bold red lettering, reaches across the road to block passage northward.

node.name: Hrendh Skogar, Barrier
node.description: The large trees blossom in abundance, hugging the edges of the pathway through its twists and turns. Small lilies and tulips grow sporadically amongst the underbrush adding a splash of color to the drab greens and brown of the wilderness. A large barricade crafted of a dark wood rests across the pathway, settled deep into the earth.

node.name: Hrendh Skogar, Animal Trail
node.description: The canopy is thinner here, allowing daylight to cast shifting shadows on the forest floor though a variety of small openings. In several spots, something appears to have dug up the trail, giving it the appearance of an excavation site. Several large bones protrude from the bottom of shallow basins carved into the tightly compacted soil.

The canopy is thinner here, allowing moonlight to cast pale shadows on the forest floor though a variety of small openings. In several spots, something appears to have dug up the trail, giving it the appearance of an excavation site. Several large bones protrude from the bottom of shallow basins carved into the tightly compacted soil.

node.name: Hrendh Skogar, Animal Trail
node.description: Large brambles line the outer edges of the trail, their pale grey limbs covered in red-hued thorns with sharpened points. A few brave rats scurry within the maze of branches, searching for any stray morsel they can feed upon.

node.name: Hrendh Skogar, Animal Trail
node.description: Just a few paces off the animal trail, swarms of flies buzz around a thorn bush, creating the illusion of a darkened cloud that permeates the air with a stench of death. Occasionally a low, thunderous growl echoes in the distance, causing a few birds to quickly fly past overhead.

node.name: Hrendh Skogar, Animal Trail
node.description: Several large, dark rocks rest at the animal trail's edge, pushed safely away to prevent any accidents. Small bits of scattered rubble remain tossed about by some unknown force. A few black frogs with bright red markings hop in and out of sight as they travel along the tan soil.

node.name: Hrendh Skogar, Animal Trail
node.description: Loud screeches followed by thunderous flapping echo though the dense woods. A large ironwood tree is strewn across the animal trail, its gnarled roots spiraling in random directions. Pieces of long, thick femurs lie in a precise pattern along the ground leading out from the fallen trunk.

node.name: Hrendh Skogar, Animal Trail
node.description: Light brush at the roadside periodically shudders and shakes, followed closely by sounds of scurrying claws accompanied by low-pitched grunts. A fallen ironwood tree is strewn across the animal trail, its gnarled roots spiraling in random directions. Skeletal remains fan out along the ground, a reminder of dangers lurking in the area.

node.name: Hrendh Skogar, Animal Trail
node.description: Gigantic foliage grows in an abundance of dark leaves, shuddering softly with the slightest breeze. Creepers spiral up the thick trunks of surrounding trees, tightly grasping the bark and cutting into the soft wood beneath. The canopy is filled with the high-pitched calls of numerous hidden birds, sporadically drowned out by sounds of fluttering wings as they dart between the heavy vegetation.

node.name: Hrendh Skogar, Animal Trail
node.description: Vibrant flowers grow in abundance along the animal trail, adding a prominent splash of color to the drab earth tones of the forest. Fragrant floral aromas saturate the air with a wide array of overwhelming scents. Small animal tracks cross the beaten path, its muddy surface riddled in a tangle of old and fresh markings.

node.name: Hrendh Skogar, Animal Trail
node.description: The dark rock walls hug the interior of the animal trail, arching downward to nothing more then a small slope. A large earthen bridge spans across a deep chasm, created by rocks and boulders falling from high atop the gigantic mountain.

node.name: Hrendh Skogar, Animal Trail
node.description: The smooth rock wall bends at a sharp angle as it comes to a corner. To the south is a large earthen bridge spanning a narrow chasm, created from debris that has fallen from higher up the mountain. Far below, an animal trail is visible following the forest's contours.

node.name: Hrendh Skogar, Rock Slide
node.description: Large liana vines sprout between stones in the massive rubble pile, crawling up the smooth rock face. Pristine white flowers adorn the thick vines, bending in odd directions as they attempt to utilize any light in the most efficient way possible.

node.name: Hrendh Skogar, Rock Slide
node.description: The rock wall to the west rises high into the sky, making climbing extremely difficult. Small grey lizards scamper across the stone with unknown intent, easily traveling across its surface worn smooth by the elements. Occasionally, a brisk breeze sweeps across the slide's face, sending small bits of rubble tumbling over the edge.

node.name: Hrendh Skogar, Rock Slide
node.description: Hundreds upon hundreds of rocks are piled on top of each other to form this natural walkway. With each step, the rubble shifts and settles, making quick passage nearly impossible. Crooked treetops reach up from the valley below, gently swaying back and fourth in the sporadic breeze.

node.name: Hrendh Skogar, Animal Trail
node.description: Copious amounts of rubble have fallen upon the pathway against the mountain's side, rising high above the original animal trail. A tangle of snake-like creepers and vines wind along the craggy surface, their pale green skin covered in a tangle of wickedly sharp yellow thorns.

node.name: Hrendh Skogar, Animal Trail
node.description: Obscure limbs form the canopy aloft, sweeping from side to side to reveal the sky above. A few dead leaves precariously cling to withered branches, their burnt yellow surfaces standing on stark contrast against the sea of green.

node.name: Hrendh Skogar, Animal Trail
node.description: A legion of animal tracks marks the trail, traveling in virtually every direction without rhyme or reason. From the forested side of the footway, a faint, rattling hiss can be heard from deep within the tangled scrub brush. The gentle shudder of leaves fill the verdant wood as the canopy sways in the slightest breeze.

node.name: Hrendh Skogar, Animal Trail
node.description: Tightly hugging the rocky landscape, the animal trail flows with each bend and turn nature bestowed upon this colossal mountain. Along one side of the path, a great earth wall reaches skyward and on the other, a thick forest flourishes allowing no deviance from the asperous trail.

node.name: Hrendh Skogar, Animal Trail
node.description: Small bits of rubble lay strewn about, not much more than random pieces tossed away from a mammoth boulder before it came to rest on the trail. A light growth of trees surrounds the path, green foliage swaying gently with any movement of the wind.

node.name: Hrendh Skogar, Animal Trail
node.description: A large granite boulder has settled on the footway, hindering passage northeastward. From here, a large trench has been cut along side the mountain, showing the destructive path this oversized rock took to reach its final destination.

node.name: Hrendh Skogar, Animal Trail
node.description: The trail slants slightly from north to south, following the curve of a large mountain's foot. Elder trees and small saplings dot a gentle slope, climbing slowly up the rocky face to its snowcapped peaks. A few wood violets grow in random patches alongside the track, filling the air with their fragrance.

node.name: Hrendh Skogar, Animal Trail
node.description: The twisting trail expands drastically as the dense wilderness of the west begins to thin here. Visible through gaps in the trees, a large mountain dominates most of the view of the northern sky. Leading down into a deep, murky trench is a steep slope that is covered with patches of withered roots.

node.name: Hrendh Skogar, Trench
node.description: Brackish water coats the area above the waterline with a thick black film as it sloshes against the worn rock walls that outline this narrow gully. To the east, its steep surface covered in a tangle of withered roots, an earthen slope rises from beneath the stagnant water.

node.name: Hrendh Skogar, Trench
node.description: Gnats and other flying pests swarm about, moving in as if working with a single mind. An antediluvian ironwood tree lays collapsed across the opening above, partly blocking the view. Thick creepers and other hanging plant life sway to and fro suspended from the fallen tree, partially concealing a dark crevice in the wall.

node.name: Hrendh Skogar, Trench
node.description: Gently, the murky water laps against a steep slope leading upward and away from the brackish filth held within the trench. A few lily pads float upon the surface, blooming with large yellow flowers and shifting with the slightest movement of the water.

node.name: Hrendh Skogar, Trench
node.description: Dark earthen walls tower high above, worn smooth over time by the unforgiving elements. Large patches of a brownish green moss flourish all around, tightly clinging to any available surface. To the west, a large slope rises out of the cool water, also coated in a dense layer of moss.

node.name: Hrendh Skogar, Cavern
node.description: Rough walls, dark in coloration, form a dome that peaks high above where a section of the ceiling has collapsed, yet there is no trace of rubble anywhere. Now in disarray, the remnants of a rough campsite remain, ready for another resident. Four thick logs are arranged around a large fire pit. Close by, a fetid pile of hay with a tattered cloak draped across it forms a makeshift bed.

node.name: Hrendh Skogar, Animal Trail
node.description: The tan trail narrows out gradually as the surrounding wilderness presses in close. The trail east slants downward into a small, narrow gully. From this vantage point, a large mountain can be made out through the swaying leaves of the trees, its snow capped summit reaching high above.

node.name: Hrendh Skogar, Weeping Willow
node.description: The pathway widens to a small clearing where a massive weeping willow has been planted, dead center. Brownish grey branches reach outward from a thick trunk flawed by deep carvings. At its foot, a thick patch of white roses flourish under the safety of the mighty tree.

node.name: Hrendh Skogar, Animal Trail
node.description: Small bits of bone are scattered about the trail in a slapdash fashion, and many of the surrounding trees have been marred by deep slashes and gouges. Within the bowels of the dense wilderness, the sharp sounds of cracking branches reverberate through the air.

node.name: Hrendh Skogar, Animal Trail
node.description: The light tan of the rugged pathway stands out in contrast to the deep greens of the lush foliage. A thick carpet of leaf litter, muddy brown in coloration, shifts with the movement of the wind sweeping through the surrounding forest.

node.name: Hrendh Skogar, Animal Trail
node.description: The large trees lining this rugged pathway rise aloft to a massive canopy, extending to overlap protectively above the trail. High overhead the dark greens shift in the breeze, causing breaks and gaps revealing brief glimpses of the sky beyond.

node.name: Tanis Belta Gaizen, Climb
node.description: Dark quartz flows like cloudy water towards the ground below. Forming a bare ripple in the cliff face that offers little more than a spot to pause before continuing your climb, the quartz transitions to mix with bands of red sandstone as it reaches up for the broad rim of the sky arching overhead.

node.name: Tanis Belta Gaizen, Clifftop
node.description: Lofting above the canyon, the cliff ends in a flat overhang of glossy rock that looks over the shadowed ridges below and provides a view of the sweeping reaches of the steppes beyond.

node.name: Prairie Grove, Brushwood Trail
node.description: Avian loiterers tease each other with twitters and tweets in the fluttering canopy overhead. The dense thicket boasts both new and old growth, with several dwellings built to entirely encompass whole tree trunks. Residents have broadened an old deer trail into a navigable path for people and horses traveling into the coppice.

Loitering crickets serenade each other by the light of stars through the canopy overhead. The dense thicket boasts both new and old growth, with several dwellings built to entirely encompass whole tree trunks. Hovering fireflies delineate a navigable path traveling into the coppice.

node.name: Prairie Grove, Brushwood Trail
node.description: The faint trail winds through the trees like a crescent moon, with several structures built in the crook. Bowed ferns and thick trees alike submit to the dominance of night, silently keeping to their stations lest aroused by wandering creatures. Both the darkness and the abundance of plant life soften the atmosphere, promoting quiet contemplation and reflection under the heavens.

The improved deer trail winds through the trees like the gracefully arcing neck of a swan, with several wooden structures built into the crook. Bowed ferns submit to the dominance of the thicker trees and greedily clench any sunlight managing to pierce the leafy branches. Both the daytime anlas and the abundance of plant life soften the atmosphere, promoting lightheartedness and relaxation for all.

node.name: Prairie Grove, Brushwood Trail
node.description: Ridged tree trunks stand as columns to hold up the verdant green ceiling sheltering the home site. Tiny winged insects move in clumps from bush to bush, performing feats of exploration of a distinctly primal nature. A few wild mushrooms sprout near a rotting stump next to the grassy path.

Towering tree trunks stand as great columns to hold up the velvety black ceiling sheltering the home site from the forces of night. Tiny glowing insects move in clumps from object to object, giving hazy snapshots of the dark thicket to observers along the grassy path. A few wild mushrooms sprout near a stump, though the blackness makes it hard to tell if they are friends or foes.

node.name: Prairie Grove, Brushwood Trail
node.description: Moss and lichen upon the trees resemble a greenish patina on aging bronze. Swathes of buttercups and violets streak the underbrush like bejeweled inlays more in color than fire, though the occasional dewdrop combined with generous daylight lends a hint of brilliance to the petals. The branches and ferns lurch forward across the path as if to protect their bounty.

Moss and lichen upon the trees resemble dark linen banners draped down castle walls. Swathes of buttercups and violets lie concealed amongst the rest of the monotonous undergrowth. The branches and ferns lurch forward across the path as if to protect their kin.

node.name: Prairie Grove, Brushwood Trail
node.description: Darkness seeps into the quiet copse, slipping through the trees and shrouding the path's subtle curves. Animals occasionally move between the houses to seek protection from the foliage, some to hide from predators, others to elude prey. Clinging to a nearby trunk, some feathers hang limply, undisturbed in the solitude of night.

Particle-filled shafts of daylight slip through the tree cover, spilling their brightness upon the clover-strewn path. Antelope and other passive mammals can be seen nibbling the foliage in between the sturdy constructions of thatch and timber. Clinging to a nearby trunk, a handful of sky-blue feathers twirls on the breeze.

node.name: Prairie Grove, Brushwood Trail
node.description: The ground's scent of rich loam coupled with the ferns' herbal fragrance transforms the plain grassland into a pristine natural paradise. Puffs of white flowers edge the deer trail, which ends in a cul-de-sac amongst the homes and trees. A circle of weathered stones rests in the middle of the small clearing, perfect for midday gatherings.

The scents of wild creatures and thriving plants in the wilderness transform the grassland into a nocturnal paradise full of thrills and wonderment. Puffs of flowers, their white hue muted by the night, edge the deer trail, which ends in a cul-de-sac amongst the homes and trees. A circle of stones rests in the middle of the dark clearing, perfect for midnight gatherings.

node.name: Western Road, Cedar Branch
node.description: Flattened, finely divided leaves release a crisp, cool scent into the shadowed bower of the cedar's upper reaches. The road below is barely visible, but through the branches stretches a rugged vista encompassing both mountains and sky.

node.name: The Black Spire, Connecting Hallway
node.description: Only a single gaethzen sphere and the occasional seam among the great stone slabs decorate the otherwise featureless, dimly lit hallway. At its sharp, perpendicular turn rests an ebony door.

node.name: The Black Spire, Connecting Hallway
node.description: Only a single gaethzen sphere and the occasional seam among the great stone slabs decorate the otherwise featureless, dimly lit hallway. Additional light streams in through an open archway to the east.

node.name: The Black Spire, Intercessor Chambers
node.description: A long hallway dotted with dozens of small doors leading to small living chambers, each door has beside it a small nameplate in S'Kra Mur script. No dust lurks in the area despite worn rugs giving evidence of heavy travel, its denizens obviously maintaining the area with utmost care. A break in the western row of doors instead contains an archway leading out to a darker hallway.

node.name: The Black Spire, Intercessor Chambers
node.description: The smaller chambers to the south give way to larger domiciles in this end of the hallway, the doors spaced further apart and of high quality ebony. The area is spotless, reflecting the orderly nature of its denizens. The wall to the north is smooth grey stone, lacking any additional chambers or furnishings.

node.name: The Black Spire, Intercessor Chambers
node.description: A long hallway dotted with dozens of small doors leading to small living chambers, each door has beside it a small nameplate in S'Kra Mur script. No dust lurks in the area despite worn rugs giving evidence of heavy travel, its denizens obviously maintaining the area with utmost care. The wall to the south is smooth grey stone, lacking any additional chambers or furnishings, while a narrow passageway extends eastwards.

node.name: The Black Spire, Equipment Storage
node.description: Boxes of provisions are stacked in orderly rows interspersed between shelves of clothing and racks of weaponry. The barest hints of dust hint at the futility of attempting to keep the area truly pristine as things are packed, unpacked, stowed, and retrieved, though no dust or mar rests upon any of the equipment itself.

node.name: The Black Spire, Cupola
node.description: The wide, domed ceiling of this area stands in stark contrast to the smaller, utilitarian halls extending outwards from it. Four white pillars rise at the cardinal points in the cupola, topped by majestic black dragon statues.

node.name: The Black Spire, Prime Intercessor's Office
node.description: A wide ebony desk dominates one corner of this stark office. Kept neat and tidy with no papers or documents, the presence of multiple writing implements and a well-worn chair still suggests its frequent use. On the other side, a plain white training mat bears the impression of many footsteps.

node.name: The Black Spire, Planning Room
node.description: Functional and circular, a square table covered with maps and tomes is surrounded by dozens of chairs of different sizes. Softly flickering gaethzen spheres dot the grey stone wall, shining a continual interplay of white light chasing darkened shadows.

node.name: Zaldi Taipa, Falconer's Chadir
node.description: Lures of all shapes and sizes are hung along the walls -- from the tiny feathered lures designed to call diminutive falconets to heavy lures covered with rabbit fur used for big hawks and eagles. Some well-worn belled jesses have been carefully placed in a cedar box to be repaired and oiled for new birds, and nearby rests an array of beautifully worked leather hoods. Small baskets are filled with molted flight and tail feathers, ready to replace any broken in the hunt.

node.name: Zaldi Taipa, Jahtinit's Corner
node.description: Sweet-smelling cedar has been carved to shape a low table that is cluttered with the current projects of the Jan Taipen's apprentice. Feathers, bundles of sage, little bowls holding half-carved beads, and even a bird skeleton or two crowd the work area. Nearby, completed items are arranged neatly, and hawk-wing fans hang on the walls, their beadwork glinting softly in the light.

node.name: The Black Spire, Initiation Chamber
node.description: Light leaks through the hatch above, casting gloomy shadows across the unnaturally warm stones that form the curved wall and scarred floor.

node.name: The Black Spire, Initiation Chamber
node.description: A single guttering torch struggles to illuminate this rather unadorned corner of the chamber. Several heavy iron rings are bolted to the wall and faded bloodstains streak the floor towards a small drain.

node.name: The Black Spire, Initiation Chamber
node.description: Several heavy metal frames contorted into humanoid postures encircle this section of the chamber. Set into the south wall is a large weapon rack.

node.name: Foot of Wyvern Mountain, Steep Trail
node.description: Wyvern Mountain towers high rises in the sky above, with a thundering waterfall cascading down its front. Several smaller peaks rise around the mountain cap like dragon's teeth, framing its snowy top. Massive boulders frame the narrow winding trail, which slopes steeply upward and appears to have been recently cleared of rubble.

node.name: Foot of Wyvern Mountain, Steep Trail
node.description: Huge claw and fang marks mar the rocky terrain, the telltale signs of battle littering the steep trail. Several of the huge boulders bear numerous dried bloodstains, and portions of the path are blackened and charred. Wyvern Mountain blocks nearly half the sky, and the thundering waterfall cascading down its front can be both clearly seen and heard.

node.name: Foot of Wyvern Mountain, Steep Trail
node.description: Blotting out the night sky, the surrounding mountain peaks jut from the ground, with Wyvern Mountain towering high over them. The trail takes a sharp incline, winding its way past a treacherous cliff. Roaring thunder from a nearby waterfall echoes through the area, the noise constant but somewhat distant.

Long shadows are cast over the trail from the surrounding mountain peaks, pairing each rock and stone with a shadowy caricature of itself. The trail continues its sharp incline, winding its way past the base of a treacherous cliff. A lone scraggly bush clings to its side, tenaciously growing despite the constant shadow cast on it from the mountains above.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Narrow Plateau
node.description: Made from a solid but somewhat slippery sheet of shale, the ledge hugs the base of a cliff that towers high above. Colorful striations mark the exposed bedrock overhead in bands of red and white, separating the greyish rock. Layers of softer stone have worn away from constant weathering, leaving gaps on the cliffside that resemble enormous claw marks.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Narrow Plateau
node.description: The path forks sharply, with what looks like a man-made trail traveling steeply upward to follow the cliff to the west. Narrow ledges made of shale lead to the east and south, marking a precarious journey through the rocky terrain. Several small weeds cling to pockets in the harsh stones in the gaps between the rocks, speaking of a nearby source of water.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Steep Trail
node.description: Patches of grass and twiggy saplings cling tenaciously to the sides of this steep mountain trail, which winds up the rocky cliff face in a rough zigzag pattern. Gushing water roars from somewhere nearby and the rocky trail is somewhat damp underfoot, making the climb up the cliff even more treacherous.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Steep Trail
node.description: This portion of the slippery path passes through a gorge between two cliffs, the ground underfoot almost sandy. Created when water washed away a layer of softer rock, the sides of the miniature canyon are streaked with flecks of minerals. Three ironwood support beams haphazardly span the gap high overhead, apparently placed here to ensure the sides don't come crumbling down.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Steep Trail
node.description: The mountain trail forks sharply along the side of the cliff in zigzag patterns, the incline just gradual enough to climb without the use of handholds. Fresh, clean water sprays through the air in a mist of droplets, making the cliffside slick and peppered with pockets of vegetation. Darkness shrouds the path, making the footing rather treacherous.

The mountain trail winds sharply along the side of the cliff in zigzag patterns, the incline just gradual enough to climb without the use of handholds. Fresh, clean water sprays through the air in a mist of droplets, making the cliffside slick and peppered with pockets of vegetation. Minerals streak the bedrock in wide bands of sunset color, glittering in the daylight.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Narrow Plateau
node.description: Wide cracks split the plateau, with three ironwood support beams haphazardly spanning the gap to form a makeshift bridge. A steady stream of water trickles through the rift, appearing to be runoff from the nearby Wyvern Falls. Rusty stains speak of minerals in the water, the small trickle creating a small puddle against the cliff face before dribbling away out of sight down the ledge.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Steep Trail
node.description: The narrow trail follows the steep incline that ends at the base of a cliff, the branches of numerous evergreen trees gracing its top. Made from shale layered with limestone and granite, the rocky wall glitters with minerals and is fairly free of vegetation. Small runnels of water flow down the mountain's side, eventually disappearing into deep chasms in the rock.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Steep Trail
node.description: Large bushes and clumps of tenacious vegetation have stabilized the mountainside, which drops off steeply to the southwest. Numerous boulders line the edge of the path, half sunk into the earth and peppered with old moss. The sound of water rushes through the area from the nearby Wyvern Falls, echoing off the cliff sides in a thunderous cacophony.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Steep Trail
node.description: Growing in the shadow of the nearby cliff is a large patch of Elyhaar Wing orchids, producing a strong fragrant odor in the thinning mountain air. Each of the delicate blooms are just barely open, showing off the white interior that resembles a jackal's curled claws. Hardy mountain bushes line the patch of flowers, giving them the appearance of a passing shadow.

The strong fragrant odor from a nearby patch of Elyhaar Wing orchids drifts through the air from the base of a nearby cliff. Each of the delicate blooms is barely visible in the dim light, only the white tips easily seen in the darkness. Hardy mountain bushes line the forking path, making the way treacherous.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Forest
node.description: A small grove of young pine trees sprout in a tight bunch, marking the edge of the evergreen forest. Their needles hued a deep emerald green, the small trees flourish in the rich soil of the mountain. Sunlight trickles through larger pines standing behind the grove, illuminating the small trees and etching interesting patterns on the mountain trail.

A small grove of young pine trees sprout in a tight bunch, marking the edge of the evergreen forest. Their needles hued a deep emerald green, the small trees flourish in the rich soil of the mountain. Shadows cast from larger trees overhead dwarf the little grove, spreading out like fingers in the murky twilight.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Waterfall Edge
node.description: Constant spray from the nearby Wyvern Falls dampens the steep mountainside that follows it, most of the boulders worn completely smooth by the myriad of droplets. The water runs down the side of the mountain in constant sheets, flowing downward through the air. Several small lilies thrive in the damp area, clinging to the edges of the rocks and soaking up the abundant moisture.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Waterfall Edge
node.description: A sizable pool has formed in a small indentation of the rock, created from the constant spray and runoff from Wyvern Falls. Smaller runnels trickle downward from the edge of the pool, flowing as a miniature waterfall before joining the much larger cascade to the west. Vibrant green moss grows on several of the large boulders in the rocky area, accenting the rough terrain with edges of green.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Narrow Plateau
node.description: Thunderous noise echoes across the mountain plateau, and water constantly sprays the rocks from the enormous falls passing close by. Visible far below, a small lake marks the bottom of Wyvern Falls, which flows down the mountain from a spectacular height. The entirety of Shard can be seen in the distance to the east, its towers and walls making the city resemble a compass.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Waterfall Edge
node.description: The constant pounding spray from the nearby falls makes the footing treacherous, which zigzags sharply to provide some semblance of footing. Moss grows thickly on the boulders in many different types, covering them in an array of multicolored speckles. Small pine saplings occasionally jut from the side of the cliff, the young trees growing nearly horizontally before bending their branches upward toward the sky.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Waterfall Edge
node.description: Several large streams of water crest on boulders buried within the enormous waterfall, making sprays that paint rainbows in the water-saturated air. Tiny insects dart here and there among the puddles produced by the spray, dragonflies and small water nymphs thriving in the moisture. Lichens resembling furry clusters of dots speckle the boulders, ranging from grey to brilliant blood red.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Waterfall Edge
node.description: The massive waterfall next to the steep path is split neatly in two by a large boulder, cascading down on either side in enormous sheets of water before joining again further down. A tiny plant grows defiantly upon the rock, clinging to it tenaciously with a mass of roots and holding onto a few sturdy green leaves. Similar plants grow on the side of the massive waterfall, bent as if bowing in admiration to their braver sibling.

node.name: Wyvern Falls, Bank
node.description: The stone along the bank is somewhat treacherous, worn smooth and slick with the relentless passage of time and water. This close to the precipice, the thunderous roar devours all other sound as the rapids race forward to plummet over the edge of the mountainside. An impenetrable mist rises from the pool far below, tiny droplets trying in vain to resist the inevitable fall.

node.name: Wyvern Falls, Bridge
node.description: The sturdy stone bridge spans the very top of Wyvern Falls as it crests over the side of the mountain. On one side of the bridge the water is nearly still, caught in the calm just before going over the drop. The world falls away on the other side into a dizzying drop hundreds of feet straight down, the falling water creating a mist rendering the distant ground invisible.

The sturdy stone bridge spans the very top of Wyvern Falls as it crests over the side of the mountain. Water flows at a steady pace, roaring down the side of the cliff and drowning out all other sound. The air is filled with a thick mist coming from the spray of the water, obscuring the dim twilight and drenching the sides of the lonely bridge.

node.name: Wyvern Falls, Bank
node.description: Following the natural layers of the massive mountain, the bank drops off into an enormous cliff, while the snow-capped peak rises high above. Wyvern Falls flows down the mountain in a steady stream, the water constantly free-falling down the cliffside in roaring sheets. A misty spray continually shoots through the thin mountain air, creating a natural rain that dampens the surrounding rock.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Above the Treeline
node.description: The cliff extends above the evergreen canopy, giving an unbroken view of thousands of pine trees. Clouds ring the purplish mountains distant on the horizon, while the towers and walls of Shard are clearly visible to the east. Numerous claw marks mar the steep mountainside, permanently etched into the hard stone.

The expansive night sky stretches above the evergreen forest, the view clear and unhindered by any foliage. A blanket of fine, bluish mist partially covers the forest, with only the tips of the trees visible through the haze. Numerous claw marks mar the steep mountainside, permanently etched into the hard stone.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Above the Treeline
node.description: An ancient bristlecone pine stands alone atop a slab of pale dolomite rock, the tree twisted and contorted by many years of harsh mountain winds. Though it appears mostly dead, the tree grows away from the ledge, separated from the younger trees by the high altitude. The air is quite thin and crisp, unable to support much moisture.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Above the Treeline
node.description: The cutoff of trees is abrupt, very few growing above the cliff as the air at the top of the mountain grows thin. Evergreen trees occasionally grow their tops just above this narrow ledge, although the expansive view is unbroken otherwise. High above, the mountain rises in a massive snow-capped peak, close enough to showcase the incredible and ancient power of nature.

The cutoff of trees is abrupt, very few growing above the cliff as the air at the top of the mountain grows thin. Evergreen trees occasionally grow their tops just above this narrow ledge, their tops shrouded in the constant mist that comes from Wyvern Falls. Darkness shrouds the mountain, its massive ice-capped peak blotting out much of the night sky.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Above the Treeline
node.description: A small stream of water trickles down the steep mountain, flowing around small rocks and branches before disappearing in the tall pine trees below. Small, sticky skunkweed flowers and tufts of grass grow next to the brook, thriving in the high mountain air. The narrow path curves to follow the mountainside, remaining just above the high treeline.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Above the Treeline
node.description: Jutting out almost directly overhead, a wide dolomite ledge shades the pathway somewhat. Numerous hardy plants cling to the side of the mountain, sheltering in the protection of the ledge above. Tufts of tall grass grow around a tall fence crafted of green bamboo that ends the mountain pathway, sturdy and very well kept.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Above the Rapids
node.description: The water-soaked bank follows a series of cascading rapids, blocked off by a steep drop that makes passage into the water impossible. Sprays of water crest with white foam and flow constantly over the shallow and uneven boulders in the water. Occasional sprays of water splash heavily against the path's edge, creating foaming white curtains that quickly fall again.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Breeding Grounds
node.description: Far above the treeline, the steep mountain is formed from large slabs of dolomite, a narrow canyon wending its way through two of the smaller peaks and serving as the wyvern breeding grounds. Numerous cracked boulders are scattered over the hollow gorge, splitting it into many sections that are mostly blocked off from each other. Bones are scattered across the canyon floor, the victims of adult wyverns feeding their young.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Breeding Grounds
node.description: A sharp ledge of pale rock juts out from the side of the mountain, hanging high over the raging rapids below. Several abandoned nests lie here and there along the ledge, scattered with the bones of deer and other large game. Clearly visible below the raging rapids is the mountain's treeline, the ancient evergreen forests covering a good portion of the steep slopes.

The sound of raging water comes from far below the high ledge, which juts out from the side of the mountain. Several abandoned nests lie here and there along the ledge, scattered with the bones of deer and other large game. Mist shrouds the mountain in a haze of thick cloud, hiding its secrets under the cover of night.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Breeding Grounds
node.description: Several large stones are arranged in a circle, marking the site of an abandoned wyvern nest. Fragments of eggshells are still visible within, scattered and broken with the hatchlings long gone. Pointed peaks rise from various points in the breeding grounds, creating natural perches from which the wyverns can survey their young.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Breeding Grounds
node.description: The walls of the mountain canyon narrow considerably to the north, making the mountain peaks seem incredibly tall in comparison. A huge and ancient wyvern skeleton is fossilized and half sunk into one of the cliff walls, its neck bent sharply backwards as if it died while in a great struggle. Much larger than any of the creatures that currently cover the mountain, the bones speak of an ancient and mysterious past.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Breeding Grounds
node.description: Steplike formations in the grey rock have resulted in numerous ledges, each one topped with a large wyvern's nest made of stones. Although most of the nesting sites in the area are currently abandoned, fresh tracks indicate the canyon is still in heavy use by the large creatures. Dried bloodstains mar the ground in places, punctuated by claw marks in various states of erosion.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Breeding Grounds
node.description: The path slopes steeply to follow one of the mountain peaks, the rock to the southeast dropping off into a steep cliff. Hidden in a small indentation in the rock is a relatively small wyvern's nest, its occupants long gone.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Breeding Grounds
node.description: The path slopes sharply to follow the steep inclines, with the northern portion of the trail heading upward toward a smaller peak that stands in the shadow of Wyvern Mountain. Made entirely of hard grey dolomite rock, the path has a chalky and uneven feel to it, making travel quite treacherous. Very little grows in the area, the conditions too poor to support plants.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Breeding Grounds Peak
node.description: The small mountain peak gives a good view of the wyvern breeding grounds. Newer and more active nests are clearly visible to the north amongst the rocks, while the southern part contains less active hatcheries and appears to be frequently traveled by hunters. South of the breeding grounds, huge plumes of mist rise from Wyvern Falls, obscuring much of the view further out.

The small mountain peak gives a limited nighttime view of the wyvern breeding grounds, much of it shrouded in a dense layer of mist. Occasional peaks rise up above the fog, looking like pale grey fingers reaching up from a shrouded swamp. Visibility is quite limited, the breeding grounds cloaked in the dull grey blanket of fog.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Ascent
node.description: Chunky dolomite rises in a steep and nearly vertical angle, the limestone having a rather chalky texture. Small handholds are carved into the rock, hinting that the steep cliff has been climbed in the past. Smaller peaks rise on either side of the cliff, much too sharp and fragile for a climbing attempt.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Ascent
node.description: Ascending cliffs jag steplike to follow the sharp incline of the mountain, the sheer rock faces broken sharply as if shattered by Kertigen's hammer. The air is quite thin, the high altitude making breathing somewhat difficult. Small patches of dry dirt are scattered here and there, falling from the highlands and collecting in the corners of the cliff's sharp angles.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Ascent
node.description: The top of the cliff looks out over the evergreen forest, the view broken by the thundering mist coming from Wyvern Falls. Several opposing peaks form a natural valley that the path wends its way through. To the northwest, the beginning of the highlands are visible, speckled with thin yellow grass that thrives in the expanse between the mountain's treeline and snowline.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Highlands
node.description: Grass grows between the large boulders of the mountain's highlands, soaking up the limited moisture coming from the snowmelt further above. Large peaks rise like enormous teeth into the sky, surrounding the highest mountain peak in a ring. Thin patches of snow lay in the shadows of surrounding stones, completely hidden from the light of the sun.

Silhouettes of large boulders dot the mountain's grassy highlands, standing sentinel over the side of the ancient mountain. Large peaks rise like enormous teeth into the sky, surrounding the highest mountaintop in a ring. Thin patches of snow lay in the shadows of surrounding stones, their pale white surfaces standing out starkly in the dim twilight.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Highlands
node.description: Standing on a steep incline between patches of short mountain grass, a chipped stone burial marker pays homage to valiant warriors who have passed on. Occasional gusts of thin air blow their way between the peaks, stirring up the snow high above and scattering their tiny crystals through the air. The ground slopes steeply as it follows the snowline, the many smaller peaks and pointed rocks emphasizing the enormity of the mountain.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Highlands
node.description: Daisies, snapdragons, bellflowers and patches of grass grow in the loamy soil just before the mountain's snowline, the natural garden fed by a tiny brook running from a small crack in the high mountain rocks. Tiny bees flit between the floral bouquets and collect the sweet nectar within them. A long flat rock serves as a makeshift bench, grown around with patches of stubborn mountain vegetation.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Highlands
node.description: Leafless stems poke out randomly amongst sparse patches of thin yellow grass growing on the steep mountain slopes. Scattered heavily among the grasses are a multitude of shield flowers, spread out in a manner resembling a miniature army dressed in vibrant purple and ready for battle. A heady scent fills the thin air, the sharp odor of ice crystals combining with the delicate smell of the hardy blossoms.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Highlands
node.description: The grassy highlands wind around a small craggy peak that blocks the view down the side of the mountain. At the base of the sharp inclline, tufts of thin-bladed grass grow tall and are peppered throughout with midnight snapdragons, protected very welll from the harsh winds. A scattering of fist-sized stones pepper the area in spots, the vestigal remnants of past rockslides.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Snowline
node.description: Wind-scoured icicles hang from the edge of the cliff's side, sharply marking the edge of the mountain's high snowline. Powdery snowdrifts create lines of white at the wind's urging, forming large drifts that densely pack into the cliff's crevices. Rough ice walls run straight up and disappear, gouged and pitted by the cold thin air.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Snowline
node.description: Cold hard ice underlies the snowdrifts in jagged edges to form rough hills and frozen waterfalls. Massive outcroppings of ice ascend up the mountain in furrowed lines of peaks and valleys as they form layered paths with the large exposed rocks. The stark contrast of the snowline is visible at the base of the cliff, which still has flowering blossoms and thin grass.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Snowy Ascent
node.description: Frosty ridges coat the few rocks that are icebound on the snowy mountainside, their craggy surfaces creating snowdrifts behind them. The nearby cliff offers some respite from the harsh wind, but not from the cold, thin air. Footing in the slippery area is very treacherous, as there are few rocks emerging through the ice and snow.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Snowy Ascent
node.description: Thick layers of jagged slate stick out horizontally from the cliff, their flat surfaces creating a natural stairway on the mountainside. A large cluster of broken icicles lies in a pile next to one of the steps, somewhat resembling an elaborate natural crystal formation. Clear rime forms on the wind-blasted side of rocks, where snow and ice cascade from high stone terraces to land in soft heaps.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Snowcap
node.description: Occasional bits of dolomite rock peek through the ice in a thin band, forming the path winding its way across the incline. Thick blankets of ice-covered snow cover each side of the narrow trail. The sheets of ice are perfectly smooth and have a pale blue tinge to them, the occasional ice melt having meticulously smoothed away any imperfections.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Snowcap
node.description: A massive avalanche has caved in much of the ice from above, creating a haphazard pile that blocks the pathway to the west. Dark boulders lay broken on either side of the glacial landslide, their granite faces rimed with a sparkling cloak of frost. Thousands of points of brightly colored light glimmer softly through the thick ice, making the white snow crystals beneath shine in the thin mountain air.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Snowy Ascent
node.description: The steep ascent to the mountain's tallest peak begins at the base of a sheer cliff, the climb nearly vertical and with very few handholds. A thick layer of ice and frost coats nearly all the rocks, leaving only small patches of dolomite free of the permafrost. Icicles hang from overhead ridges, many of them reaching nearly to the ground before being broken by the harsh mountain wind.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Snowy Ascent
node.description: Cracks in the cliff wall indicate the great force that presses down on the mountain's sharp ascent toward the peak. The ledge is barely large enough to stand on, and is covered in a thick layer of ice that greatly impedes any progress.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Snowy Ascent
node.description: Strange bands have formed in the surface of the ice, layered in wavy patterns from snowmelt caused by slight warming from the sun. The ledge is barely more than a foot wide at this point, offering very little purchase to climbers. Several gouges mar the icy cliff here and there, the marks resembling those from enormous claws.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Snowy Ascent
node.description: The rocky cliffside juts sharply through the ice, which is covered in snowdrifts and the shattered remnants of icicles. A sharp blast of cold winds gusts towards the top of the mountain, blowing around a small flurry of snowflakes.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Snowcap
node.description: A sharp curve in the frozen path leads to the top of a sheer rock wall. Far below, an evergreen forest spans across much of the mountain, and the hills beyond are covered in waves of grass that yellow in the summer heat. The spire of Shard's tower rises above the tree line, while further off in the distance the north ridge of the gondola is barely visible.

A sharp curve in the frozen path leads to the top of a sheer rock wall. Dim silhouettes of evergreen trees break the night far below, the landscape beyond a pitch black. In the distance, a soft glow emanates from the streets of Shard, the Great Tower in the city's center piercing the sky like a single shining crystal.

A sharp curve in the frozen path leads to the top of a sheer rock wall. Far below, an evergreen forest spans across much of the mountain, and the hills beyond harbor vast collections of colorful flowers that herald the new life of spring. The spire of Shard's tower rises above the tree line, while further off in the distance the north ridge of the gondola is barely visible.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Snowy Ascent
node.description: A broken and long-abandoned sword lies entombed beneath a thick layer of ice, buried blade first in the face of the cliff. Rocks jutting from the ice and snow create the barest indication of a ledge, difficult to pick out among the less stable patches of ice. Thick snow blows around in swirling flurries, picked up by the fierce wind.

node.name: Peak of Wyvern Mountain
node.description: The peak of Wyvern Mountain rises to pierce the sky, offering an unbroken view that spans multiple provinces. Raven's Point nestles in the mountains of Forfedhdar, while Corik's Wall steadfastly guards the Blackthorn Canyon. Shard's bridges and towers grace the many converging rivers to the east, while past the Dragonspine mountains, the Sana'ati Dyaus tree of Leth Deriel is in full bloom, just before the city of Crossing at the horizon. The land is caught in the bloom of spring, cloaking Elanthia in the vibrant green of new life.

The peak of Wyvern Mountain rises to pierce the sky, offering an unbroken view that spans multiple provinces. Raven's Point nestles in the mountains of Forfedhdar, while Corik's Wall steadfastly guards the Blackthorn Canyon. Shard's bridges and towers grace the many converging rivers to the east, while past the Dragonspine mountains, the Sana'ati Dyaus tree of Leth Deriel is in full bloom, just before the city of Crossing at the horizon. The land is caught in the grip of summer, waves of heat rising slowly over all of Elanthia.

The peak of Wyvern Mountain rises to pierce the sky, offering an unbroken view that spans multiple provinces. Raven's Point nestles in the mountains of Forfedhdar, while Corik's Wall steadfastly guards the Blackthorn Canyon. Shard's bridges and towers grace the many converging rivers to the east, while past the Dragonspine mountains, the Sana'ati Dyaus tree of Leth Deriel is in full bloom, just before the city of Crossing at the horizon. The expansive landscape holds a thousand different autumn shades, blanketing Elanthia in vibrant color.

The peak of Wyvern Mountain rises to pierce the sky, offering an unbroken view that spans multiple provinces. Raven's Point nestles in the mountains of Forfedhdar, while Corik's Wall steadfastly guards the Blackthorn Canyon. Shard's bridges and towers grace the many converging rivers to the east, while past the Dragonspine mountains, the Sana'ati Dyaus tree of Leth Deriel is in full bloom, just before the city of Crossing at the horizon. Snow covers much of the land, Elanthia frozen in lonely grey as it sleeps in winter's grasp.

The peak of Wyvern Mountain rises to pierce the night sky, offering a clear view of both the heavens and the darkened land. The lights of Raven's Point shine in the mountains of Forfedhdar, while the southern lands lie dark under the cloak of night. Shard's glow plays off the the many converging rivers to the east, while past the dark fingers of the Dragonspine mountains, the city of Crossing illuminates the horizon. Darkness settles over the land, quieting the view from the lonely mountain peak.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Snowcap
node.description: The snow at the top of this treacherous cliff is crusty and unstable, frequently giving way and making passage incredibly difficult. Splintered shards of ice lie haphazardly about, crystalline missiles dropped from the overhanging cliffs when their weight becomes too much to bear. Fine, powdery snow piles in sparkling drifts that hug the mountain's cliffs, filling in the shatter lines that spiderweb through the ice sheet's surface.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Snowcap
node.description: A pile of boulders rests uneasily at the top of the mountain's cap, feathered in elaborate ice crystal patterns growing over their surfaces. Gritty snow crusted over with frozen melt forms a thick layer over the granite rock below, making the few bare spots seem dark by comparison. Shifting ice from the massive glacier occasionally gives off a sharp crack that pierces the air, breaking the lonely silence of the frozen mountaintop.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Breeding Grounds
node.description: Large spines of dolomite break through the floor of the canyon in several places, reaching upward like fingers grasping toward the sky and making the pathway sharply angled. Though no wyvern nests are built in this small corner of the gorge, many claw tracks marring the ground betray the presence of the winged beasts.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Breeding Grounds
node.description: Bleached bones are stacked up in piles six to eight feet high, marking this area as the wyverns' dumping ground. Although the majority of the bones come from game animals, the long-dead remains of several adventurers are indiscriminately mixed into the piles. Rusting and worn-out equipment sticks out here and there, decaying rapidly in the moisture-heavy air.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Narrow Cliff
node.description: A completely sheer wall of limestone rock rises to the north, gradually narrowing into a high and inaccessible peak. The stone is somewhat chalky, the powdery limestone mixing with the air's heavy moisture and piling in clumps at the edge of the rocky walls. Small bunches of pink clover grow from the makeshift dirt, tenaciously clinging to life in the harsh environment.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Narrow Cliff
node.description: The narrow ledge forms a very shallow cavern in the side of the cliff face, offering some limited shelter for travelers. A makeshift firepit is dug into the ground just before the shelter, with a small supply of wood set out in a bin. Flat, wide boulders circle the firepit, providing a place to sit and rest.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Forest
node.description: A small patch of vivid blue flowers grows in a rich streak of soil in a gap between two trees, hugging the edge of a steep cliff. Wide spaces between the tall trees allow them to grow oversized feather-shaped branches, fanning out over the shady path. Long strips of bark hang from several of the evergreens, marred at the edges with bite marks that expose the pale white sapwood underneath.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Forest
node.description: A narrow deer trail winds its way through the thick evergreens, bending sharply to follow the densely packed trees that line the mountainside. The soil underfoot is rich with loam, permeating the air with a hearty, earthy smell. Occasional tree roots and fallen logs jut from the ground, hugging the edge of the cliffs running along the steep mountainside.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Forest
node.description: Most of the lower branches of the trees in this area are completely gone, apparently eaten by the local wildlife. Evergreen branches high enough to escape being eaten create a sheltering canopy that casts the forest in an eternal twilight. The ground underfoot is covered with a thick blanket of dead pine needles, which are much more prominent near the trunk of each aging tree.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Forest
node.description: The cliff's edge hugs the side of the treacherous mountain path that wends its way around the edge of the lonely woods. An oddly-shaped pine tree clings to the side of a nearby ledge, its trunk growing at a sharp bend and its roots forming a spiral to grasp the viable soil. Smaller saplings have taken root at the very edge of the cliff, tenaciously clinging to life in the harsh environment.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Forest
node.description: A dying tree juts from of the ground at an odd angle, its top caught in the branches of the surrounding pines. The tree's exposed roots hang halfway off the side of the nearby cliff, putting it in a somewhat precarious position as it clings to the surrounding trees. Mounds of browning pine needles from the fallen tree litter the forest floor, choking the already sparse foliage.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Forest Clearing
node.description: The trees break into a small clearing that sits at the edge of a steep cliff, providing a clear view of the thundering cascade of Wyvern Falls constantly rolling down the face of the mountain. A patch of daisies grows in the small clearing, surrounded by strands of long green grass. The remains of a campsite lie in the center of the clearing, a small firepit surrounded on two sides with logs that face the enormous waterfall.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Forest
node.description: An animal trail winds down the side of Wyvern Mountain, thick on either side with bushes and undergrowth speckled with lilac. Several boulders and smaller trees frame the edge of a nearby cliff, which drops off suddenly to the southeast. The air is rich with the scent of pine needles, the smell clinging longer than usual in the thin mountain air.

An animal trail winds down the side of Wyvern Mountain, thick on either side with bushes and undergrowth speckled with lilac. Several boulders and smaller trees cluster near the edge of the path, showing only darkness beyond. Mineral-rich mist clings heavily to the ground at the base of the trees, giving the air a strong earthy scent and stirring up ghostlike wisps with every breeze.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Forest
node.description: A small space between two enormous boulders leads to a dead end, blocked off by the steep slope of the mountainside. Bands of granite run through the cliffside in a variety of sunset colors before turning to grey limestone further up. Moss and lichen grow heavily in the small space, while the branches of pine trees overhead allow only the occasional dappled ray of light through.

A small space between two enormous boulders leads to a dead end, blocked off by the steep slope of the mountainside. The cliffside is shrouded in heavy darkness by the nearby trees, casting long silhouettes that play with the imagination. Mist clings heavily to the damp area, making strange patterns in the air as it moves listlessly near the ground.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Forest
node.description: The ground is sharply angled to follow the mountainside, the branches of several trees brushing against the ground. Exposed roots tangled in the earthy loam make for a decent trail, packed down by the frquent passage of animals. Huge boulders litter the surroundings, their surfaces speckled with dots of moss and lichen.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Forest
node.description: Widely spaced at even intervals, a set of four nearly identical cedar trees creates a natural crossroads in the forest's deer trails. Overhead the branches tangle with each other, creating a crisscross pattern of pine needles. The forest floor is fairly clean, most of the natural sunlight blocked by the thick pine trees and inhibiting the forest's undergrowth.

Widely spaced at even intervals, a set of four nearly identical cedar trees creates a natural crossroads in the forest's deer trails. Overhead the branches tangle with each other, blocking out the dim twilight almost completely and making the crossroads very dark. The night is alive with sound, crickets chirping and the occasional hoot of an owl echoing across the lonely mountainside.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Forest
node.description: The forest abruptly stops at the very edge of the clifftop, the trail ending at a large boulder with an enormous drop just past it. A small patch of golden sun roses grow next to the boulder, soaking up the abundant light at the edge of the forest. Large evergreen trees grow close together, the dense undergrowth crowding the space between them and blocking any progress in following the cliff edge.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Crystal Spring
node.description: Water flows steadily through the high mountain rocks, washing down from narrow channels between large boulders that are perfectly smooth on all sides. Numerous plants surround the natural spring, with small tendrils of Elven ivy growing over the banks and beds of vibrant green moss covering many of the rocks surrounding the spring. The water is very clear and the pebble-speckled bottom of the spring is quite visible.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Crystal Spring
node.description: Steady streams of water filters past the lichen-covered banks, and a constant fine mist clings to the surface of the spring. A variety of small pebbles cover the bottom of the spring, tumbled clean by the constant motion of the water. The sound of more rapidly rushing water can be heard from the south, heralding the water's steady flow toward Wyvern Falls.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Crystal Spring
node.description: Water continually flows into the spring from narrow cracks in the rock to the north, fed by the continuous snowmelt from the top of the tall mountain. Kokona reeds thrive in the stiller parts of the water near the banks, and occasionally dragonflies dart from one to the other. Softly glowing lichen speckles the nearby banks, illuminating the spring with ten thousands points of yellow light that mimic the star-filled heavens.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Rapids
node.description: The water flows rapidly to the southwest as the spring's water overflows its natural basin, tumbling constantly and cresting white over the rocks. High cliff walls contain the rapids, narrowing the wide spring into a steadily flowing stream. Constant spray is thrown into the air by the numerous small boulders, the mist falling back to join the rapids in a steady rain.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Rapids
node.description: Constant thunderous roaring from the nearby Wyvern Falls fills the air, sounding much like a dragon angrily awakened. The pull of the water carries small leaves and branches with it, the bits of debris rapidly drifting toward their inexorable fall. Large plumes of mist are sprayed up through the water, saturating the thin air with its humidity.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Waterfall's Crest
node.description: The rushing water falls suddenly off the steep edge of a cliff, forming a constant stream that drops down the side of Wyvern Mountain in an enormous waterfall. Constant whitecaps and waves appear and disappear, ever at the mercy of the raging streams. Large rocks stick up from the rapidly flowing water, giving them the appearance of a steady struggle upstream just to stay in place.

node.name: Shattered Oak, Ranger Guild
node.description: Beneath the fallen tree, a hermitage of branches and leaves protects the visitor from the outside world. Coarsely woven squares of cloth spread atop tufts of dried grass make simple yet comfortable seating. Above, birds whistle softly as they hop from one perch to another, and the sweet smell of drying herbs drifts gently through the underbrush.

node.name: Shattered Oak, Work Area
node.description: No wider than a water trough and twice the height, this alcove is hardly more than three fallen branches precariously aligned to form a small chamber of green. Several large bolts of cotton cloth, two clay pots filled to the brim with a green paste and a small canvas sack that holds an assortment of herbs are neatly stacked at the far end.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Temple Path
node.description: A small and well-maintained garden has been built on either side of the pathway, flourishing in the shady space between the tall mountain boulders. Bright blue violets, scorpion blossoms, and snowdrops grow in abundance, filling the air with a heady scent. Twin fountains flow on either side of the path, made from natural rocks that spill crystal clear water into perfectly circular ponds.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Temple Path
node.description: Numerous shoots of bamboo frame the small path, blocking most of the view of the surrounding rock and forming a lush green canopy overhead. Blue paper lanterns hang on poles that follow both sides of the narrow path, casting a serene glow that tinges the area in gentle cerulean hues. Well-tended herbs grow in stone-lined garden beds, protected from the harsh mountain wind by the hardy bamboo plants.

node.name: Wyvern Mountain, Temple of Serenity
node.description: A building can be seen past a garden to the north, its elaborately tiered roofs staggered to overlap each other and follow the mountainside. Lush bamboo grows on either side of the twisting path, the intertwined and gently swaying tops making an ever-present rustling sound. Green grass grows sheltered by the shoots of bamboo, and the dirt path transitions to tightly interlocked stone.

node.name: Temple of Serenity, Garden Entrance
node.description: Detailed stone statuary intertwines with the lacy foliage of this garden, mirroring the pale hue of the temple that rests at its center. The building's simple, elegant construction is overwhelmed by the intricate carving adorning its facade, from its niche-carved walls to its elaborately tiered roofs, each staggered to overlap the last as they climb upward to embrace the temple's integration into the mountainous terrain. Luminous in the daylight, the ivory edifice rises to peek above the surrounding tree tops.

Lacy foliage wends around numerous pallid statuary that blaze with inner light, illuminating the temple that rests at this garden's center. A sweeping ivory edifice rendered even more luminous by the surrounding shadows, the temple is itself of elegant construction, from its niche-carved walls to its elaborately tiered roofs, each staggered to overlap the last as they climb upward to embrace the building's integration into the mountainous terrain.

node.name: Temple of Serenity, Sanctuary
node.description: Rendered in burnished gold, the elaborate carvings of the temple's exterior seem to only expand once within its walls, covering the entire ceiling here. Patterned rice paper set within golden framing serves as interior walls, the warm glow of lanterns on the other side casting distorted silhouettes upon it. Set into the floor is a lidless, vertically-slitted eye crafted from amber and onyx, its edges limned in inscribed silver.

node.name: Temple of Serenity, Sanctuary
node.description: Placid blue streaks across the bottom of the rice paper, as the scene upon it expands to include a multitude of robed figures seated around the banks of a lake, their raised arms meeting golden rays of sunlight. Carved into the ivory of the opposite wall, a series of fantastically embellished niches holds opened scrolls bearing silver gilt text. The scent of heavily spiced incense wafts in from the north, bringing with it the soft murmur of footsteps and song.

node.name: Temple of Serenity, Sanctuary
node.description: This portion of the chamber is arrayed entirely in shades of gold, from the gilded carving that covers all of the hard surfaces to the intense glow of the illuminated honey-hued rice paper of the interior wall. The incense is very strong here, suffusing the very air with its thick, nearly intoxicating perfume. Musical chanting comes clearly from the east, a call and response of wordless tones that evoke the sounds of a gently burbling stream.

node.name: Temple of Serenity, Podium
node.description: The walls here, two paper and two stone, are nearly obscured by the many floor-to-ceiling lanterns that line them, washing the eerily-still temple attendants in a saffron light that matches their silken robes. Mostly Elotheans and Humans, they stand upon the raised platform in the room's center, eyes closed and faces tilted skyward as they chant. Perfumed smoke filters down from the cloud-carved ivory censers set into the golden sun-patterned ceiling, tickling the senses with rich, spicy notes that play atop an earthy musk base.

node.name: Temple of Serenity, Meditation Chamber
node.description: The majority of this chamber consists of large, silver-lined pools filled with shimmering koi. Slender pathways curve between them, swelling at uneven intervals to accommodate movement around those seated in meditation without causing disruption. Water cascades down the rippled golden walls, catching in ivory basins before trickling across multitudes of crystalline bells on its way to the ponds below.

node.name: Temple of Serenity, Narrow Hallway
node.description: The elevated height of this passage alleviates any impressions of tightness engendered by its narrow width. Tranquil wave patterns wrought in alternating silver and gold stream through the ivory of the walls, the hammered metals catching light from the hanging lanterns to scintillating effect. Carried in on a soft breeze from some unknown source, the delicate scent of lotus blossoms lingers in the air.

node.name: Temple of Serenity, Narrow Hallway
node.description: The ceiling here descends, tapering down to a much more humble scale that stands in striking counterpoint to the grandiosity of its etched silver embellishments. Set into the ivory walls, hammered golden troughs hold resplendent lotuses floating within crystal clear waters, their pale, unblemished petals illuminated from above.

node.name: Temple of Serenity, Side Room
node.description: The heady aroma of dried lotus blossoms mingles with that of the sweet almond oil in the decanters situated upon the low, golden table in this small room's center. Wooden benches, heavily gilded and lacquered to a flawless sheen, line the elaborately carved walls, providing a place to sit in respite before or after enjoying the adjacent cleansing spring. A silver serving cart sits near the entry, holding a large golden pitcher.

node.name: Temple of Serenity, Cleansing Spring
node.description: The smooth ivory flooring of the room above gives way to a solid gold coating that lines the natural depression created by the spring. An eye has been carved into the gold along the bottom, its inset amber iris split by the crevice through which the water rises up from within the mountain itself. Warm enough to melt away tension, the mineral laden water holds a slightly earthy smell that lingers within the resultant steam.

node.name: Underground Passage
node.description: Slender wavy lines have been carved into the ceiling in a meandering pattern, encircling golden disks from which hang a series of red paper lanterns. The carvings become more complex as they radiate outward, incorporating alchemical symbols and jagged geometric glyphs. Set into one of the walls, a curving osage door looms, its frame nearly as tall as the passage itself.

node.name: Underground Passage
node.description: Bamboo torches edge the walls, providing such bright light as to blur any details within the stone with their dancing flames. Cool air from the west brings with it a distinctly floral scent, pricking at the senses. Moving toward the aroma, the passage widens, opening up into a cavern.

node.name: Underground Passage, Hidden Garden
node.description: Six evenly placed skylights, each covered with clear quartz, are cut into the rough stone of this cavern's ceiling, their angled design funneling sunlight down upon carefully tended flora. Unexpectedly lush, the decorative grasses and hostas are nevertheless overshadowed by a wide variety of irises in a dizzying array of colors. Even more remarkable, many of the flowers bear blooms of quite unusual size, some nearly dwarfing a dinner plate.

Slender pathways delineated by spiraling bamboo torches lead between the plantings, casting flickering shadows that dance between the leaves and petals of the fantastically lush flora in this cavern. Though nearly eclipsed by an abundance of irises of remarkable size and a wide array of colors, decorative grasses and hostas splay outward in artful angles that speak to the careful planning and tending involved in their growth.

node.name: Underground Passage
node.description: Pale paper lanterns reveal a swarm of beetles scrambling across the craggy stone of the ceiling and walls, their shiny, jewel-toned bodies acting as a constantly shifting, living tapestry. Their versicolored chitin catches in the lantern light as the skittering rainbow horde mills about in an oddly restive fashion, avoiding the floor entirely and appearing to have no interest in leaving their little patch of stone.

node.name: Underground Passage
node.description: The fossilized skeleton of a large, winged beast is embedded into one of the rocky walls in this long, mostly unadorned tunnel. Though its left wing is missing entirely, the sheer size of the bones tells of the creature's former glory. A cluster of footprints overlap one another in the sooty dust beneath the single lantern that hangs from the ceiling, a visible indicator of the high traffic this area must see.

node.name: Underground Passage
node.description: The surfaces here have been polished to a smooth sheen in striking counterpoint to the rough-hewn stone to the southwest. Quartz inclusions glitter brightly in the dim illumination, a scintillating play of light working across walls, floor, and ceiling alike. Sounds of bustling activity come from the east, where glimpses of robed figures milling about can be seen.

node.name: Underground Cavern
node.description: The passage opens dramatically here, terminating in a gargantuan natural cavern. Carved into the rough stone of the floor, alchemical symbols radiate outward from the towering white marble obelisk that stands in the center, stopping to encircle each of six onyx slabs along the curving walls. Streams of Elotheans and Humans, all clad from head to toe in saffron silk, move in and out of the chamber, attending to various ritual tasks.

node.name: Temple of Serenity, Guildleader's Study
node.description: The warm scent of sandalwood peppered with sweet clove and anise infuses this room, generated by the foot-tall sticks of incense within an urn upon a low, curved table. Vibrant reds and blues mingle with the dominant gold of the color scheme, their eye-catching tones found in the brightly enameled wall decorations as well as the floor's lapis and carnelian inlay. Brilliant golden rays of sunlight stream in from above, caught and intensified by quartz sheets layered over the skylight channel carved into the stone.

The warm scent of sandalwood peppered with sweet clove and anise infuses this room, generated by the foot-tall sticks of incense within an urn upon a low, curved table. Vibrant reds and blues mingle with the dominant gold of the color scheme, their eye-catching tones found in the brightly enameled wall decorations as well as the floor's lapis and carnelian inlay. Caught and intensified by quartz sheets layered over the skylight channel carved into the stone above, the pallid glow of the stars illuminates this chamber, giving it an unearthly appearance.

node.name: Temple of Serenity, Secluded Library
node.description: Dark mahogany walls surround the small but functional room, which is lined on all sides with small bookshelves, each containing neat rows of books. Gaethzen orbs illuminate the room from overhead, spilling a soft light over the room that's rather easy on the eyes. A rather elegant return desk next to the front of the room holds a few books to be put away, and comfortable looking suede couches make for a good reading spot.

node.name: Below Wyvern Mountain, Flensing Room
node.description: Body-sized steel boxes sit atop pedestals near the shelf-lined walls that enclose this adjunct laboratory. Though set up primarily for stripping flesh from bone, the space retains most of the amenities of the main lab to the west, albeit on a smaller scale. Twin granite slabs sit between tool carts and cabinets, forming narrow aisles that lead to a long, double basin sink at the back of the room.

node.name: Below Wyvern Mountain, Main Laboratory
node.description: Spacious and bathed in warm, golden light from a hanging gaethzen sun, the room sports an impressive array of accoutrements for both research and reflection. Placed around a sunken central drainage collection tub, gleaming bronze stands have been situated next to each of five granite slabs, holding tools both arcane and surgical. Plush leather lounges flank a burl wood table, set off from the active research area by matching bookcases.

node.name: Cold Laboratory, Hallway
node.description: Built into the side of the mountain, the narrow hallway winds through walls of solid stone. Elegant paintings of Shard and the surrounding mountains hang in even intervals, lit by gaethzen orbs that shine brightly. Narrow panels of clear glass line the bottom half of the walls, filled with snow that keeps the hallway very cold.

node.name: Cold Laboratory, Hallway
node.description: Built into the side of the mountain, the narrow hallway winds through walls of solid stone. Elegant paintings of Leth Deriel and the surrounding forests hang in even intervals, lit by gaethzen orbs that shine brightly. Narrow panels of clear glass line the bottom half of the walls, filled with ice floating on a thin layer of bluish water.

node.name: Cold Laboratory, Hallway
node.description: Built into the side of the mountain, the narrow hallway winds through walls of solid stone, ending at a solid wall. Elegant paintings of the rolling hills and plains west of Shard hang in even intervals, lit by gaethzen orbs that shine brightly. Narrow panels of clear glass line the bottom half of the walls, filled with extremely cold water from glass pipes that flow in from somewhere unseen.

node.name: Cold Laboratory, Work Station
node.description: The air is quite chilly, cold enough to leave ice crystals with every breath. A medium-sized and rather functional laboratory is set up, with a central marble table as the main feature. Nearby, a row of cold lockers is designed to store specimens for later use, and a tray of very clean tools is set up near the table.

node.name: Cold Laboratory, Work Station
node.description: The air is quite chilly, cold enough to leave ice crystals with every breath. A medium-sized and rather functional laboratory is set up, with a central marble table as the main feature. Nearby, a row of cold lockers is designed to store specimens for later use, and a tray of very clean tools is set up near the table.

node.name: Cold Laboratory, Work Station
node.description: The air is quite chilly, cold enough to leave ice crystals with every breath. A medium-sized and rather functional laboratory is set up, with a central marble table as the main feature. Nearby, a row of cold lockers is designed to store specimens for later use, and a tray of very clean tools is set up near the table.

node.name: Cold Laboratory, Work Station
node.description: The air is quite chilly, cold enough to leave ice crystals with every breath. A medium-sized and rather functional laboratory is set up, with a central marble table as the main feature. Nearby, a row of cold lockers is designed to store specimens for later use, and a tray of very clean tools is set up near the table.

node.name: Cold Laboratory, Work Station
node.description: The air is quite chilly, cold enough to leave ice crystals with every breath.
